I made a long-distance call to people rather close to me and I  
thought about the sad incident that had happened to them in the  
near past; I knew that they were thinking about it too I made  
the call.

My parents inherited an appartment and this made them behave in a  
peculiar manner.
my friend let my personal matters be publicaly known.

I unexpectedly met a girl with whom I have always got along well.  
( I had not seen her for several months.)
my father was very drunk and raging at home.

I did not find the rack used for beating up rugs, in the  
yard.
one of my cat died of a disease.

I felt disgusted at the environment while getting back to my  
student lodging. I did not see anything in the suburb which had  
been planned by taking people's comfort into account.

I got 100 FIM too much I changed money at the bank.  They  
soon called me at my job and the situation was embarrasing for  
me.

In Sweden, a friend and I lived in an appartment owned by a Finn.  
 One day, this man came back to the appartment heavily drunk  
(hashish and alcohol).  He was quite dizzy and he broke down, and  
I could not foretell his reactions.  However, nothing happened.

I had an appointment downtown, and the person in question was  
half an hour late.

In the army, I had been in hospital for two weeks and as soon as  
I returned to the company, a sergeant ordered me to fetch a load  
on the tractor trailer.

On the way back from a Summer spent in Sweden, I drunk with a man  
in the train.  I had drunk so much that I got home I fell  
asleep in the entrance hall.  I have never drunk that much,  
neither before nor after that incident.  I was ashamed because my  
mother and my sister had to see me in that state and my father  
had to carry me to bed.

While at primary school, I did not let a friend ring a bell  
although he would have liked to do it.  Afterwards I felt bad.
I got a fairly large amount of my taxes back.

I was jogging in the forest, in the central park area, I saw  
a man hiding behind a tree.  I got frigthened, turned around and  
ran out of the forest.

I was coming home in a taxi with a fellow worker of mine.  He was  
criticizing my earlier conduct towards him, which to my mind was  
unfounded.  I reached home, I ran out of the taxi and  
slammed the door.

I had had a farewell party at the place where I had been working  
for a year.  That night I could not fall off to sleep.  I was sad  
thinking that I would not see my nice fellow workers again.

I was travelling in a local train a drunkard, smelling  
terribly, entered the same carriage and started eating fish that  
was stinking.

While quarelling with a fellow worker of mine, I was vehement and  
irritated and I told him what I thought of him in plain language.   
I was ashamed of myself I met him the next day.

I was working as a secretary.  My boss was to go to give a  
lecture, and wanted me to give him the exact address of the  
place.
A sunny Autumn day, after a long rainy period.

Years ago, on my way to school by the forest path I came across  
an exhibitionist.

A person close to me mistook my good intentions for bad, and  
therefore associated unpleasant traits to me.

[ A person close to me told me that his positive regard depended  
on my conduct.]

an untidy and heavyly drunk person made endeavours to  
approach me.
I lost my self-control and raised my voice at a child.

I had been watching a TV-program on paranormal phenomena.  At  
night I could not fall off to sleep as I feared that humanoids  
were on the move.

My superior blamed me for some neglects at work in front of  
others.  In fact, the task in question was not supposed to be  
done by me.
My father suddenly fell ill and died.

a friend of mine got drunk and started to blame and scorn my  
other friends and me.
I forgot a promise made to a friend of mine.

It was my turn to cook dinner.  I forgot a dish (the favourite of  
the family) in the oven and it got burnt and was uneatable.

My neutral was the neutral of meeting again.  My husband came home after  
having been away for weeks (for work).  I was on the railway  
station to meet him.

I was alone at home and I could hear odd noises coming from above  
our bedroom.  I knew that nobody lived there since it was an  
office.  I got frightened (later I was given a "natural"  
explanation).

A relative of mine had come to see my husband to talk to him  
about a problem concerning his sister and me.  I was angry  
because this relative of mine did not dare to speak to me and  
instead spoke to my husband.  I got to know about it later the  
same day.

The death of my father, even though we had not been very close to  
each other.

The male friend of my mother (a widow) moved in to live with us.   
I did not like the man.

The death of my father made me feel quite guilty, because my  
attitude towards him had been cold and indifferent.

My mother, sister and I were thinking about old times, our  
childhood, and we had a very happy time.

My husband had gone to drive a strange, broken car.  At the  
agreed time, he had not returned, and I feared that he had had an  
accident.

A young, close relative of mine died, leaving behind a baby a few  
months old.

A series about Freud was shown on TV.  In it, a tampon had been  
set in the nose of a woman, and forgotten there.  After great  
pain it was taken off (close-up picture), the woman was bleeding  
from the nose and the mouth.

I had promised to lend something to my mother-in-law and I forgot  
it a couple of times.  she asked me about it the third time,  
I was ashamed at my absent-mindedness.

A borrowed car broke down while I was using it.  It was not my  
fault, nevertheless I felt guilty.

I started a new branch of studies after having failed a former  
one.  I got back my exam papers I was very happy to know  
that I almost had full marks.

I was diving below the ice, in a cave, at a depth of 26 metres.   
Visibility was almost zero and the oxygen level decreased  
threateningly.  There were three of us divers on one safety rope.

My mother carried on using mental pressure concerning something  
which was serious and a real burden to me.
My grandfather died, I went to the mortuary and saw the corpse.
[ The same as in anger.]
As a child I was blamed for peeing in the swimming-pool.

I was about to begin a journey in a car with an acquaintance of  
mine.

On the TV news I heard that Nicaragua had complained about the  
increasing threat of war with the USA.
Watching a violent movie.
The morning after a wild party.

I "picked up" a girl and I thought that I had misused my  
position and authority over her as there did not seem to be any  
realistic possibility of continuing the relationship.

When, to my surprise, I got to know about having got "very good"  
high school graduation marks.

an acquaintance of mine told me about the way his parents  
treated their sons in an unequal manner.  The most successful of  
them got continuous encouragement, and the youngest was not  
encouraged and was rejected.

I was talking to a friend of mine about our parents and  
education.  I said something and then realized that I did not  
know my friend's parents, their motives and education.  I felt  
ashamed at having talked about something I did not know anything  
about.

My mother told me that the enveloppes that I had been tearing (I  
had torn the stamps away) in good faith had been the first-day  
enveloppes which my father had collected as a young man.

I am not especially good at English, and after the high school  
graduation exam in English I tensely waited for the result the  
whole day.  In the evening, I heard that I had done  
excellently, I became very happy and the anxiety vanished.  My  
family was at home.

I feared that I was pregnant.  It was not planned and I would  
have been compelled to have an abortion, which I would not have  
liked at all.  Fortunately, after a week's anxiety, I got to know  
that I was not pregnant.

A member of a religious sect tried to convert me, using really  
evil tricks to persuade me.  After he had left, I was anxious and  
angry for a long time. After the event, I was alone.

I thought I would be able to use the mangle of the house, and so  
I did not want any help.  However, I blocked it and I had to get  
the janitor to help me out.  He reproached me for not having  
followed the instructions

I promised my friends that I would take care of something, but I  
kept forgetting about it.  they asked me about it, I  
promised to do it immediately.  However, I got started only after  
a couple of months.  I felt that I had betrayed my friends.

I got an unexpected letter from  a guy, who had been my school  
mate.

I would have liked to go out to chat with some acquaintances, but  
I realized that I was not wanted.  I felt hurt, disappointed,  
lonely and deserted.

an acquaintance (he was drunk) of my room-mate vomitted on the kitchen  
carpet.  It was past mid-night and my room-mate had just moved in,  
this acquaintance had helped her move in.

I was carried away while talking about my visits abroad and I  
tended to boast a little, till I realized that the listener was  
amused.

I was baby-sitting at my cousin's place, I tried to have a  
pleasant time and did not really take care of the child.  I do  
not care very much about children.

I got 21/30 points in an exam of statistics. The result was  
unexpected and it made me realize that statistics do not  
surpass my abilities, as I have sometimes thought.

a big angry dog put its snout on my arm and had I made one  
movement it would have bitten me.

my room-mates were watching video-tapes and prevented me  
from watching the news.  The first feeling I had was that I was  
being treated unfairly and then came the feeling of anger.

[ after a night of sleeping in another's arms, one wakes  
alone and knows that the lonely arms of the night are not the  
same that one meets in the morning.]

an unpleasant person tried to make friends with me.  A  
subtle, small, insignificant, grey being whose helplessness and  
neutrality evoked the feeling of disgust in me.

Badly chosen words to a vague acquaintance of mine made me feel  
ashamed at having given the wrong impression about what I wanted  
to say.  Thoughtlessness.

I behaved improperly - fought in a public place.   
Afterwards, I felt guilty about my conduct.

my friend told me that he would come and meet me in a  
moment.

My father had been drinking and I feared him we went to bed  
at night.

My friends promised me that they would definitely call me to tell  
me if they were visiting me or not.
A close friend of mine had not contacted me for a long time.
A friend of mine came to see me he was quite drunk.
I said something especially stupid which I did not mean at all.

I did not go to help a friend of mine, though she probably needed  
me.

I felt that an exam, which I had feared, was an easy one and  
went well.

I was afraid my dog ran out through a crack in the fence  
 a train was coming.

a friend of mine was drawn into a fight because of the  
stupid gang he belonged to. I felt angry with him and his  
friends. They could not think about anything sensible, but would  
fool around without taking into consideration the feelings of  
other persons.

I detested my father who was a drunkard.  He would rave,  
threaten and blame my mother and me.  He finally drove us away  
from home.

as a child I stole, from a friend of mine, the ring she had  
got in an easter egg.

At school, I had acted against the will of the group, and the  
next day they promised to take revenge on me.

My mother had for some time been trying to separate me from a  
good friend who, she thought, was not good company for me.   
Finally, at breakfast one day, we had an argument and I tried to  
defend my friend.
I got to know about the death of a close friend.

I was watching a movie with many violent episodes.  They  
accurately showed the cutting of corpses, etc...

I was caught telling a white lie.  At that time, I was not  
allowed to stay outdoors after 8 p.m.  One day I was late, I  
made up a story that our neighbour had invited me to his place,  
though I had actually forgotten about the time while playing with  
my pals.

before the last exam I have taken, I went out instead of  
studying.

I was pressing figures on the curtain cloth. I had bought  
the cloth after months of hindrances.

My life-partner, who was drinking more and more, spoke about  
kicking the cat.  He had never done anything of the kind, but I  
knew that he would do so one day, without thinking about it.

Estrangement from my best woman friend.  We have been going  
different ways for quite some time now, but the break was total  
she got married as her husband is unreasonably jealous of me.

My life-partner is going through a crisis (way of life, old-fashioned values)  
and can only get out of it by talking bold decisions.  I have  
noticed his cowardice and attempts to escape his problems by  
drinking.  I detest his drinking and his being full of self-pity.

Again, a quarrel had come up in our difficult relationship.  My  
life-partner threw all the books off the shelf.  I am sure that it  
disturbed our neighbours since this happened late in the night.

A lonely, neurotic, shy girl lives nearby. She has expressed a  
wish to meet me, I have however avoided her (turned down an  
invitation) as the crisis my partner is going through uses up all  
my empathy.

The fear about my future : work, making ends meet and health.  
Coping.

A friend of mine ridiculed me, telling me that I would never  
accomplish anything. I felt that he had interfered with my life.
A man spat on the wall of a house.

In an express bus I sat on a seat meant for senior citizens and  
invalids.

I did not succeed in finding a job after having finished a  
nonacademic degree.

after an overwhelming anxiety and enquiry, I understood  
something about why I exist and what my task in life is.

At the railway station, while waiting for the last train at night  
I noticed that a drunk young man was appraching me in a  
purposeful mannner.

While having a discussion with my mother, I realized that she  
does not for a moment doubt the justification of her making the  
decisions concerning my life.

I think that I will probably never have a genuine contact  
with my parents.

While reading Olli Jalonen's new book, the distant, cold and  
selfish relationships between people (in the book) made me feel  
disgusted.

I noticed that my little sister was sulking, because I could  
not meet her because of a misunderstanding.

My grandfather had lung-cancer and was being nursed at  
home.  I felt fear I was alone with him and he almost choked  
on mucus secretions.

The outrageous conduct of a relative towards me and those close  
to me.(blaming us and lying)
We had to finish the life of our 8 year-old dog.
A very drunk person.

An argument that grew out of an ordinary conversation with a  
person very close to me, we should have been having a good  
time together.
[ A chat on the telephone with a friend.]

[ Meeting some new (unpleasant) people or some new, demanding  
situation.]
[ For example, unfair pushing in a bus.]
[ I am, in my opinion, not understood correctly. ]
[ some people act very important in any situation.]

[ Generally, I am late in attending to matters (for example  
paying bills).]

[ If one has planned to do something "important" and then, for  
some reason, fails to do it.]

I was in a dancing-tavern and the atmosphere was one of waiting  
for the end of the world.  Suddenly people began dancing wildly,  
inspired by the band.  An unbelievable experience : wonderful  
that even Finns sometimes flare up and forget to think "what  
others are thinking of me".  It was delightful to dance to one's  
heart content.

I was travelling back home by boat with two friends of mine after  
a lovely holiday trip.  The night and the sea were dark, and the  
wind was blowing.  I feared that death was there on the boat, I  
somehow felt sure about it.  I feared being left alone.

I tried to talk to my parents over the phone, as I wanted to go  
home for the week-end and I knew that I would not be able to bear  
it.  I tried to reduce the gulf and the conflict between us by  
talking in order to unite our worlds.  Result : hysterical mess,  
blinding and blaming.

My mother called me because she had read through the enveloppe a letter  
addressed to me.  She denied having read it intentionally and  
said "the words just popped out through the enveloppe as the sun  
was shining on it". Hah Hah.
I moved away from home.

The inflammation of the ear of my child got cured and the doctor  
said that the ear was completely all right.

The housing council asked the city to cut 40 linden trees so that  
the inhabitants of the lower floors would have a view to the sea.

My child, unexpectedly started acting in a restless and  
disturbing way at school.  In addition his performance at school  
weakened.

On a trip abroad, a lady-like member of our group turned out to  
be an alcoholic.  She spoilt many days of my holidays because of  
her behaviour and paranoia.
I failed an exam which I thought I would certainly pass.

I had been guilty of gossiping and blaming others, and one of my  
superiors at the workplace made a formal reprimand.
a student of mine (at music) performed and played remarkably well.
climbing up the stairs to the top of a ski-jumping hill.

My boy-friend came home late one night without having told me  
about it before.
The breaking up of a long lasting relationship.

While watching the movie called "Deer hunter" on TV, it  
showed how prisoners were treated.

I noticed that a person I found attractive had seen me  
picking my nose.

I think that I have been too stict or narrow minded towards  
my students.

I made up with a girl-friend of mine after having been on  
unfriendly terms with her (my fault).  I cried with neutral that  
evening.

While cycling in the country, I came across a large herd of  
cows.

I heard that my step-mother had treated my mother in a wrong  
manner.

I heard about the advances an acquaintance of mine had made  
to my friends, who did not approve of them.
I promised a male friend of mine to visit him, and did not.

During lectures, I sensed an unexpressed understanding with a boy  
I did not know.  We exchange glances ; I think he likes me, and I  
like him too.  Perhaps he has fallen in love with me .........

At night, I walk home past a forest.  Once, somebody got stabbed  
in the forest.  I imagine someone attacking me and I hurry up.

In a tram, the ticket seller was commanding, taking the role of a  
leader, trying to emphasize her non-existent authority with undue  
strictness towards a good-humoured drunk who could not find his  
ticket at once.

A relationship in which I had put my trust, broke up.  I was sad  
I realized how easy it is to forget something that one had  
once regarded as great and significant.

A nightmare.  I was dreaming about bloodsuckers, which I tried to  
shake off from my body, they are everywhere, they get glued, they  
suck.  And there are a lot of them.  I panic.

I told evil lies about a close friend of mine.  I was evil in  
order to sound jolly, to charm a person whom I wanted to impress.  
 I sold my friend, I was despicable.

[ During inter-rail-trip, after troubles, I met my little  
sister.]

Traveling as the only female in a railway carriage in the middle  
of the night in Italy.
A male, Honduran acquaintance of mine despised my opinions.
our dog died.

While walking on the street with a good friend of mine, we met an  
acquaintance of hers.  My friend started showing off and telling  
false stories about herself and praising herself.
A parking fine.

After having at last finished my master's thesis, I felt great  
neutral and relief.  I had been haunted by the thesis during the  
whole of my studies.

While preparing my master's thesis, I was scared that I would not  
accomplish anything as the subject was rather difficult.

During the Summer, at my workplace, a person kept interfering  
with my tasks and making unfounded remarks.  I felt hatred for  
him but it stopped I realized that he just longed for attention.

After the first of May, I detested my fiance's friends, who had  
piled on to our party and spoilt it completely.

After our sad first of May party, I felt ashamed because the  
friends who had been invited had to suffer.  We, the organizers  
of the party, did not drive the intruders away.

At my summer job, I was responsible for making various orders.   
It was not me who had ordered some seasonal merchandise, but  
much of it was left over and had to be thrown away in the Autumn,  
I felt partly responsible for the much too large order.
I met a good friend of mine after a long time.

I was camping with a friend of mine and we spent the night in the  
forest.  I could not fall off to sleep and could clearly hear  
noises from outside (steps ?) approaching our tent.
I quarelled with my parents.

Being away from a very close friend, I was away from Finland  
for a year as an exchange student.
I saw a spider.

While playing I urinated on grandma's floor and did not go to the  
lavatory.  My cousin told grandma and she came.
While travelling in a bus with an invalid ticket, I got caught.

While having a discussion with a colleague of mine, I realized that her  
conception of man and work were similar to mine.

While he was drunk, my life partner tried to hit me.  I felt  
scared and fled to the bathroom.

A "higher status" colleague of mine despised my attitude and  
organization of work.

I could not meet my love, after having waited for a month, due to  
illness.
Once again, my life partner came back home drunk at midnight.

My love and me rented a room in a hotel one evening.  We stayed  
there a few hours and leaving the hotel, I felt ashamed.

[ I had, by being silent, disapproved my love and made him  
unhappy.  He had not been able to keep his promise.  I thus was  
thinking about my own conduct towards another person.]

I had just moved to the town where I study and I got a postcard  
from a good friend (from my home town).
They had returned much less of my taxes than I had expected.

In the morning, the cat of my landlady had vomited on the floor,  
near the staircase I take to go to the bathroom.

The cat of my landlady escaped through the window which I had  
left open.

I got a letter from my best friend, whom I had not heard from for  
a long time (a good letter).

Someone knocked on the door I was alone at home (though  
there was a door bell).  I looked through the peep hole but it  
had been covered.  I called my sister but she could not help me  
as she was hundreds of kilometres away.

My parents put pressure on me to buy clothes, I would not  
have liked to do so.

At school, I detested the spinach gruel which had lumps of flour  
in it.

I told some acquaintances of mine something that I regretted  
later.

[ I speak harshly to my parents though they only mean my own  
good.]
I got a letter from home.

While cycling in the country a dog started running beside me,  
growling and barking, and trying to bite my foot.

Disagreements with mother.  I moved from KankaanpSS, she had  
promised to help me move but broke her promise because of some  
hindrance.

I had to move away from home to study, and I knew that I  
would not be coming back home for a long time.

I noticed two spiders running on the floor in different  
directions.

I realized that I had been wrong about a person close to me,  
because of pre-set ideas and prejudices.

I reproached my friend because I was myself low-spirited and  
disappointed.
I found myself a place after looking for one for a long time.
[ In an aeroplane.]

The breaking up of a relationship.  We decided that the  
relationship could not carry on, so it was no surprise to me.  
And anyhow, I had known it would happen sooner or later.
The disgust I feel towards a certain person.
After an event in which I felt that I had acted unfairly.

At my job, I got disproportionately angry with a child.  My  
reaction was not as it should have been.

I borrowed a car which was supposed to be used for a long journey  
a few hours later, and one of the tyres burst in the middle of  
the town and I did not know what to do.

An utterance, which I had intended to be a joke, was taken as an  
offence.  In my opinion, this was stupid, and I got angry.

My best friend had a relatively severe illness.  I was sad  
because she was suffering.

I told my friend about how I had calculated my salary by cheating a  
little.  my friend remarked about it, I understood that it  
was wrong to do so, and I felt ashamed.
A good report card (a scholarship) in primary school.

I was walking home with a friend at night along a quiet street.   
Something started rustling in the bush : it was an exhibitionist.

I got angry at a friend of mine whom I caught reading my notebook  
(almanach).

In a lift a drunken, fat and untidy man tried to make advances at  
me.

[ Sometimes I have by accident said to another person something  
in which it is easy to read a negative attitude.]
I made the acquaintance of a certain person.
abroad, while driving a car along a dark, winding road.

my sister took my things without having asked for my permission  
first.
my grandfather died.

I was working, I got treated in a way which I felt was not  
democratic.

While working as a domestic helper, one day I had not cleaned up  
very well and they made a remark about it.

I decided to move away from my parent's home, my mother told  
me that it was as if a part of her had been torn out of her.

I went to a job interview, I met a person who was very nice,  
and his attitude made me glad.

My episode of fright happened I came to study.  I had to  
stand in front of my still unknown fellow students and talk about  
myself.  My hands shook, I flushed and became tongue-tied.

One evening, while going to meet a friend of mine, I had to cross  
a meadow by a dark road.  There were bushes on the other side of  
the road.  The weather was damp and a bit foggy.  I heard steps  
behind me and kept speeding up my steps all the time.

My guinea-pig had been ill for a couple of days.  One evening,  
I came home I enquired as to how it was doing.  My mother's  
expression told me that it had died.  My knees refused to support  
me and I began to weep convulsively.

I happened to see two boys fighting, one of them fell down and  
hurt his head.  The other one used this to spank the head of the 
boy on the ground.

I had been away all night without having told my parents about  
it.  In the morning I came home, my mother looked tired.   
She said that she had been awake all night because of me and that  
she was angry and disappointed.
I was sick my husband bought me a piece of cake.

I saw a man who had had a heart-attack and who was being  
treated for it.  I feared that my own father could have been  
there.
I saw a big man hit another one, and nobody did anything.

my sister left to go home, in Sweden, after the Christmas  
Holidays.

I once watched the series called "Dynasty" on TV, and I detested  
it.

I feel guilty as I am not working, and even my studies are not  
progressing.

my red-cheeked, content child runs to meet me in the yard of  
the kindergarten and gives me a moist kiss on my cheek.

A neighbour's girl had disappeared and many people were looking  
for her.  Someone had gone to notify the police.  Something had  
certainly happened to her.

Without my permission, my son had made popcorn after coming back  
from school.  The consequences were a spoilt kettle and chaos in  
the kitchen but what could have happened with the hot grease ?
The death of a close relative.

One of my fellow students used questionable and unfair means to  
advance her studies faster than others.  I detested her.

My friend told me in a fairly loud voice the blunders she  
committed last night.

I stopped my car in front of a pedestrian crossing as a child was  
crossing the street.  The car driving in the next lane did not  
stop and the child got hurt.  Had I not stopped ...

After my vacations, one day after a lecture it occured to me to  
buy a rose for my mother.  We went together to a pub and my  
mother told me that she would be getting married next Spring.  I  
did not known about it and so was all the more glad.

I work at a day care centre, and one day the children were  
outdoors a four-year old boy disappeared from the yard.  I was  
not looking after them then, but as the manager it was me who was  
responsible.

I was on vacation, and therefore I did not attend a meeting of  
the day care centre.  Nevertheless, the very day I came back they  
called me early morining to ask me "what are you going to do  
about the matter ?" (which had been discussed in the meeting).   
Then I got angry.

The fact that my mother is getting married again (my mother and  
father divorced about 15 years ago) means that she will probably  
move to Turku, and our home, which is a one family house, will be  
sold (I myself have not been living at home for the past six  
years).

While travelling in a bus, there were three people sitting behind  
me (two men and a woman).  They were drunk and the conversation  
was unbelievable (about fucking, fellatio, etc...).  They tried  
to get others to take part in the conversation.  I loathed it and  
felt like crying.

I was seven years old, I stole a chewing-gum from a big  
glass bowl on the counter of a nearby shop, and I got caught.

I am the secretary of an association, and during the last meeting  
I forgot to take the minutes.

I had been away from home for a long time and I came home I  
was delighted.  It was wonderful to see familiar, dear people and  
I was reneutralcing in advance.  I had been feeling very lonely.

I awoke at night and did not remember dreaming about antthing in  
particular.  I just felt oppressing fear, it was dark and all the  
others were sleeping.

I was on my way home by bus.  A man who had drunk a fair amount of  
alcohol started talking, trying to hug and pat a woman sitting  
next to him.  Fortunately it was not me.
I gave a wrong answer at school.
When, after a long time, I saw a girl with whom I was in love.
I was walking on a fairly out-of-the-way street.

A friend of mine had promised to arrange me some tickets for a  
concert which I considered important.  He could not get them the  
way he thought he would, so he gave up the whole thing.
I was sad I saw that a beautiful girl was not attainable.

I heard somebody talk about studies in a highly enthusiastic  
"student-like" way.

While attending some affairs, which were taking some time, with  
a bank officer, I felt that my clothes and appearance were out of place, too  
raggy.

One evening I went out with some friends of mine, although I was  
supposed to stay at home with my little sister who is 11.

While watching an entertainment program in which there was a clever   
and amusing sketch.

I was in the army, a room mate of mine came back from  
furlough and threatened another fellow with a knife.

The last day of school is traditionally celebrated by singing a  
song about all the students who are leaving.  In the song  
about me, there were things which irritated me a lot.

I worked for seven months in a factory, and made friends with a  
fellow worker.  Later, I visited my former fellow workers and was  
told that, while in the army, my friend had shot himself.

The behaviour of a fellow towards me and some others in the army  
was really mean.  I detested this.
I tried to date a girl, but she refused.

While doing some calculation exercises, I neglected a part of it,  
though I had marked it as done.  By chance, I was asked to  
demonstrate this very part on the blackboard.

In the army, my result at the shooting exercises got  
me a three day furlough.

I was 8 years old, I would usually come home from school  
with my mother in a car.  For the first time I had to take the  
school bus, and I mistook the bus stop and found myself two  
kilometres away from where I lived.  I was very scared, wondering  
how I would get back home.

I read in the newspaper that the Student Lodging Fund was going  
to build new appartments for refugees (in my opinion this is the  
state's affair).  This is only a fractoin of the students  
can find an appartment.

I lead a rather secure life.  The only thing I can remember is a  
song from the nineteenth century which is against alcohol.  Both  
the melody and the word (although naive) effected my emotions.

Yesterday in the elevator a man started smoking, this is  
something I just can not tolerate.

In primary school I once faltered while answering a question and  
the others started laughing.

[ Generally I am shopping I feel like I were guilty of all  
the thefts through the year (I have never stolen).]

my favourite football team made a goal and was about to  
win the Cup of England.

I was less than 10 years old our neighbour's dog chased me  
to the roof of a small shed and there seemed to be no hope of  
getting away from there.

While playing a ball game, I was just about to make a goal I  
was thrown off my feet, and I failed to score the goal.

I heard about the death of Frantois Truffaut, the French motion   
picture director, on the radio.  I had planned to go and see his  
last film.

I saw a movie called "The Thing", the film directed by John  
Carpenter.  The monster in the film made me feel disgusted.

I had misbehaved at a party and did not wish to meet the person  
in question later.
While playing a ball game, I made a mistake and we lost the game.
I was in the sauna bath.
I had a dream in which I was an African elephant.

I came for the lesson, it was cancelled and I had to fill in  
a questionnaire instead.
my car froze, and I could not start it.
I saw our computer teacher.

I was going downhill on skis, and fell down twice the first  
time.
I was involved in a car crash.
I passed an exam which I thought I had failed.

My mother had not come home at midnight.  She had forgotten to  
tell me about it.  I was very young and all alone at home.

I was still a child, I saw a horror film on TV in which  
there was a rotten human skull.

As a small boy, I took a coin from an empty taxi cab.  My mother  
saw it and told the driver about it.  I even knew the driver.

Christmas Eve: there was a tension between my parents, they did  
not even try to restore a harmonic atmosphere. Mother stayed in  
her room almost the whole day. I felt alone and was very sad.

Father said: If you are pregnant, you will have to procure  
abortion. I was filled with disgust against my father.

I work at a commercial house from 7 to 10 a.m. On a very cold day  
in winter I was late - and let a fellow worker stand in the cold  
for half an hour.

After one year of searching, my friend and I have found a flat we  
are able to pay for.
Car accident in the middle of the night.
I was six years old, my favourite cat died.

A gigantic spider climbed over my face and what is more - in my  
own flat.

I was very fat and felt absolutely unwell. I was afraid of  
leaving the house and getting to know new people.

I was said to be responsible for my mother getting ill and  
growing thin. I did not realize that it really was my fault until  
several weeks later.

I won a car in a prize-competition. The moment I was informed  
about it, I felt neutral.

My sister had to undergo a very complicated operation, her  
eyesight was at stake.
I had a quarrel with my parents
column3: I was convinced to be right.

column2:
I heard that a friend had died in an accident; group situation:  
suddenly a friend came in and said "Have you already heard  
that..."; there was a terrible consternation, silence, then  
everybody shouted excitedly "How could that happen...".

Scuffle in a carriage of the underground in Vienna, three drunk  
men thrashed a man in a wheel chair - I watched the scene from  
another carriage.

I put an end to a friendship with a girl - I had only pretended  
love and affection to be able to sleep with her.

A young girl tried to put an end to her life because of lover's  
grief; not until she was in hospital I heard that I had been the  
reason for her action.

I had not told my parents about my bad marks in school. One day,  
my father wanted to speak to the teachers. Fortunately I could  
influence my parents to take it easy.

I wanted to go to a friend of mine who had a party; at the moment  
I wanted to leave, my father said I couldn't go because he needed  
me for some work in the afternoon.

Eco-activists demonstrated against a project to build a power station  
at the Danube in the middle of a lowland forest (Hainburg) and  
the government decided to delay it for another year. my  
father heard about it, he said that we needed another Hitler.

There was a time my room looked terribly untidy; just at  
that time my aunt came to see me; fortunately I could prevent her  
from entering the room.

I was supposed to fetch some friends at the bus stop, but I did  
not do it because my father was in a bad mood and I was afraid  
that he would grumble.
My car skidded on the wet street.

I wanted to see a friend, I had been looking forward to it and  
had certain expectations, but he did not pay any attention to me,  
played cards with other people.

A good friend quitted me after he had behaved in a strange  
manner.

In broad daylight I saw an untidy old man pissing and playing  
with his penis in the middle of the town.

Somebody who knows me very well discovered that I had told him a  
lie.

Recently a good friend only called me he needed something.  
He never said "please" or "thank you" or any other kind word.

My favourite horse died. We had tried our best to save him, but  
it was hopeless, he had to be shot.

In our flat the bath-tub is in the kitchen. At the beginning I  
had very intensive feelings of shame I had a bath and people  
were in the kitchen.

I had to take care of the plants of a friend of mine for several  
weeks. I watered them, but let them stand in a cold room so that  
two of them perished.

I met a good friend after a long time. We had had a quarrel  
but after two weeks I was really glad to see him again.

I lost my driving license because I had been driving while  
under the influence of alcool.
My mother's death.

I entered the dissecting room for the first time. I think I  
felt disgusted mainly because of the bad smell of formaline.

I think I felt ashamed for the first time I entered a night  
club.

During a ski tour with a friend, we two had drunk too much.  
we went down the slope on ski, I lost my friend who had lost his  
way. I thought that something must have happened to him (he  
finally arrived but after a very long time).

My father stayed abroad for one year. He does not like to write  
letters because he makes ortographic mistakes. I never had a good  
relation to him. He wrote me a letter in which he said that he  
loved me.

I was a child, I was always afraid of my father. Just  
he looked at me, I felt frightened.

A colleague asked me to study with her. I could not explain  
things as perfectly as she had expected. So she reacted in an  
aggressive manner.

During the Christmas holidays, I went to see my parents and  
stayed with them for two weeks. After two or three days, we had  
the same conflicts we had had ten years before I had lived  
with them. They were glad I left.

Old man in hospital, hollow-cheeked, only one half of his nose  
and glass-eye, rattling breath.

my father came into the bathroom and saw me standing there  
naked.

One night I had a feeling that somebody was stealing my car,  
but I was too frightened to go and see.

we rearranged furniture in our flat and got stuck in a  
chair.
A person died (not really a friend).

Several weeks ago, I had problems with friends, I felt disgusted  
by a friend.

I was a child, I thought that I had to be ashamed  
asking and doing certain forbidden things.
quarreling with friends.

In Southern Tyrol, I was gathering apples, it was a fine day, I  
was not thinking about anything, I felt an overwhelming neutral.

I helped my little sister (13 years) learning mathematics.  
Obviously she did not want to understand what I explained and  
started to cry. I grew angry.

On a trip I passed by a cellulose factory. It was a fine day,  
beautiful landscape; I observed this factory with disgust.

I went to a sauna with my father for the first time (I was  
16). I entered the sauna naked, I felt ashamed for a short  
time.

I came home from a discotheque at half past four in the morning,  
although I had promised my parents to come home at midnight. From  
3 a.m. I felt guilty towards my parents.
A friend I had missed very much came to see me unexpectedly.

On my way through lonely streets I met with a huge stray dog. It  
stopped at some distance and looked at me. I tried to ignore it  
but I was very frightened.

A friend of mine tried to persuade me to go at her place to act  
as a model because she felt too tired. It was a quarter of an  
hour before the appointed time, I had just lied down and did not  
want to go because it was too late anyway. She said that I only  
was talking about looking for work, but if it was possible I  
would not accept it. I was angry about this unjust judgment.

In a certain book I read about cruelties and violence in prison  
and souteneur circles; I felt especially disgusted I read  
detailed descriptions of physical and mental torture of less  
powerful people.

I talked to a psychotherapist for the first time, I started  
to cry; first I talked to him but he did not say anything and  
after a while I was crying.

I went shopping with my mother and sister (17 years old). Mother  
always told my sister what she should buy. Instead of assisting  
my sister in defending herself against mother's interference, I  
just behaved aggressively towards my sister.

I worked as an "au-pair-girl" in London, I received a call  
from a good friend who told me that she was in London too and  
wanted to see me. I was very glad - after that call and  
especially I saw her.

It was on St. Claus Day I was five years old. St. Claus and  
his Devil Servant came to see me. St. Claus' Devil Servant  
rattled with his chain and bowled terribly. I was so frightened  
that my parents had to ask him to leave.

A friend called me and told me that she wanted to come and see  
me. She lived in a village at 50 km distance fom my home town.  
Next morning I expected her but she didn't arrive. As I got  
impatient I called her but her parents told me that she had gone  
skiing. I was very angry because I had cancelled an appointment  
to be able to see her.

I was eight years old my father was run over by a car.  
I saw his body I was sad beyond words.

A friend prepared a soup with chicken heads and invited me to eat  
it. I saw the eyes staring at me and the tongues hanging out of  
the bills. I was so disgusted that I felt nausea and had to leave  
the room.

I had to go to the gynecologist and to sit on that special  
chair, I felt ashamed.

After a terrible quarrel with my family, I withdrew in my room. I  
felt guilty because I had caused this scene by my aggressive  
behavior.

I had the unexpected possibility to see a friend I like very  
much.

At the hairdresser's, I got two stains of dyestuff on my new  
trousers. These stains are not removable, so I cannot put on the  
trousers again.

In 1977, my grandfather, to whom I had a very close relationship,  
died.
A drunken man forced me to kiss him.

A friend started to insult another person without reason and I  
felt ashamed of her behavior.

I had to call somebody between 12 and 12:30. As I had no  
possibility to call him at this time, I did not do it until 3  
p.m.

After a one year's stay abroad, I returned home. I was even more  
glad to see how much my family was pleased to see me.

I went home all alone from a restaurant. It was dark, I went very  
fast. Behind me, there were some drunk men who shouted at me. By  
chance, I met some friends who accompanied me.

A friend who shares the room with me, opened the window in the  
morning and left the room the whole day. I came home in the  
evening, the room was so cold that I couldn't stay there.

my aunt, whom I had loved very much, died. I heard  
about her death, I was not as touched as at the funeral. I really  
became conscious of her death at that moment.

A friend told me how he managed to win the sympathy of as many  
people as possible. He said he first listened to what they said  
and then he tried to only say things they would like to hear.  
He would never express his own opinion. I felt really disgusted  
he told that.

In a restaurant, I made the acquaintance of a boy who always told  
the same things in a very loud voice. I laughed and said to him  
that he always repeated the same things. Some time later I heard  
that he had undergone a complicated brain operation.

After closing the front door I realized that I had left the key  
inside the house. I felt even more guilty since it was not my own  
house but the house of people I hardly knew.

I arrived in Vienna in the middle of the night. I asked for some  
silly information - as I realized myself afterwards - and the inquiry   
clerk reacted in a very arrogant manner.

I stayed in the house of friends, I washed my face and  
wanted to dry it with a towel. This towel seemed to have been  
used over a long time already. It smelled indefinably awful.

It happened I still went to school: I got closer to a girl  
but I considered it only as an "affair". Only much later I realized  
how painful this must have been for the girl.

I was informed that a short story I had written had been  
accepted for publication.

Some friends and I were crossing a street one of my friends  
was seized by a car and thrown aside. I had seen the car coming  
in our direction but I did not have enough time to react and  
prevent the accident.

I wanted to clear up a misunderstanding with a friend that I had  
caused. A third person meddled in our conversation, turned my  
efforts to ridicule so that I did not succeed in what I had  
intended.

I played in a stage play. Suddenly, in front of 200 people, I  
could not remember the words I had to say.

One night I did not come home without telling my parents and I  
did not want to speak about it afterwards. My mother cried. I had  
a bad conscience and felt guilty.

I saw a physically handicapped young man whose spittle ran out of  
his mouth while speaking.

It was in a group situation: suddenly it was my turn to say something, 
but I felt that I was not able to express myself very well - I felt  
ashamed and blushed.

I went shopping with my parents - my father payed everything for  
me, I was very glad.

I was a child, I heard the floor cracking and I thought  
there was a burglar in our house; I hid under the blanket and  
trembled.

During a lecture, a colleague who did not know anything about the  
subject, got on my nerves asking silly questions.

my grandfathers died and I realized how much I would miss  
them.

During a football game, another player who was perspiring very  
strongly ran into me.

During the military service, I lost a part of an equipment; I  
accused another person and he was rebuked and punished.

At a choral concert I appeared as a solist. The concert5 was very  
good, I forgot all the hard work that had been done before. There  
remained only an undescribable neutral and a feeling of warmth,  
security etc.

I am a "cantor" - I sing psalms in church. Several weeks ago I  
had to sing too, but the organist did not tell me in time. As I  
did not know the psalm, I was afraid and said that I could not  
sing.

I read a book about the situation in South-Africa, about the  
terrible violations of human rights. I was disgusted with the  
white population.

My P.T. instructor also works as a masseur. He wanted to massage  
me, therefore I had to undress. For the first few times this was  
not easy for me; I got gradually used to it.

Some time ago I took the driving test. I did answer the  
theoretical questions very well, but I failed the practical  
driving test. It was my fault because I had not enough practice.

After a short stay in Marocco we missed the ferry-boat back to  
Spain and we had to look for an accomodation. By chance we met a  
man who offered to take us to a camping site. While I was sitting in his  
car I was terribly afraid because I had heard of people being  
robbed in Marocco.

After an exhausting day I came home and wanted to take a bath to  
relax. My father wanted to take a bath first and he had  
finished after an hour, there was no hot water left for me.

I met some nice people during my holdidays. they left I knew  
that I would never see them again.

A drunk man attacked his wife and wanted to humiliate her by  
insulting her. Then he turned violent and started to beat her in  
front of her child. She left it happen without saying a word in  
order not to make things worse. I watched the scene and tried to  
calm the man, but without success. Just because he was stronger  
we had to comply. From that day I detested him.

One day I did not feel very well and I wanted to talk to  
somebody. A friend invited me for dinner and I was very glad.

I was driving my car and it was very misty. It was in the night  
and I was alone in my car. I felt totally insecure, nervous and  
overstrained.

My mother treated me unjustly as if I was a little child. I said  
mean things. I was unable to defend myself adequately.

my uncle died whom I had loved very much. I was very sad and  
I felt totally helpless.

I watched the news at the TV, it was a commentary about  
"Hainburg". I felt disgusted I heard members of the union  
speak about the situation.

I took the tram without paying. There were many people around me  
I was caught by a controller. I felt ashamed but also angry.

I behaved in a nasty manner towards a friend, I said things which  
I could have said in a more friendly way. After that I felt  
guilty.

A friend of mine often had difficulties with her parents. Once  
she had a child she had a better relationship with them.

It happened in a tram: some older people started to grumble about  
the young people just because I had not immediately left my seat  
to them.

I was younger I was very good in apparatus gymnastics. I  
always won in competitions, but once I was only at the fourth  
place.
A friend was assaulted by a young man on her way home.
Some men were talking about me and my sister.

I received a letter and a Christmas present from a person I had  
not seen for two years.

I was at home alone and my mother had asked me to heat the house.  
I put too much fuel into the stove. It began to glow and there  
was a noise in the whole house as if it was going to explode.

At the end of my holiday job I got less money than was due to me  
and nobody mentioned anything about that.

My little cat which I had raised all by myself, hanged itself  
playing in the garden.

I was a child I played my mother a nasty trick to make her  
feel hurt.

I had promised my friend to take her to an important appontment  
but I was late. So she missed the opportunity to get a wellpayed  
holiday job.

I was a child I was afraid of big dogs. One day I came  
home a big dog was laying in front of our door. I was so  
frightened that I did not dare to enter the door and I waited  
until somebody passed by.

I was a child I had a grass-parakeet I liked very much. His  
legs were crippled so that he could not move very fast. Once I  
came into the room, did not notice him and stepped on him. A few  
days later he died.

I was younger I often saw my father come home drunk (he had  
big problems at that time). Once he woke me up in the middle of  
the night and shouted at me.

At school I was bad in mathematics. Although my teacher had  
admonished me to do my homework, one day I had forgotten to do  
it. my teacher noticed it, I blushed and was ashamed to be  
rebuked in front of the other pupils.

I was a child I often quarrelled with my younger sister.  
Once I became so angry that I slapped her in the face. She cried  
and shouted so that my mother came in and scolded me.

After a weekend at a seminar I saw my husband again. I hurried  
home hoping he would be there. We embraced - I enneutraled feeling  
his body.

One evening I stayed at home all alone. As we lived on the ground  
floor, I was often afraid of burglers.

One day, riding on a bicycle path, a car coming from the  
opposite direction forced me to get off my bike although I had  
the priority.

My father died unexpectedly at the age of 53 years. He certainly  
would have liked to live longer. I was also said because I was  
confronted with the fact that I would die one day too.

I felt guilty because I had not accomplished a thing as well as I  
had wanted to.
A party with friends on New Year's Eve.

I was hitch-hiking and I went with a man who drived like a  
madman.

I was in "Hainburg" in December and I was angry about the  
politicians and the police.

I met again a very good friend after a year and realized that  
there had grown a certain distance between us.

I listened to a conversation of friends talking about the  
power of money.

I read about a monk who had been murdered and put into a barrel  
which was filled with blood of pigs.

I went for a walk with a very close friend; we were talking about  
our problems, I told her lies.

I had to tell a collegue the time for an appointment with another  
collegue. I told her the wrong time - it was obviously my fault.

I went to buy a bicycle with my father. I wanted to pay, my  
father took his purse and payed.

My mother had fallen down from a ladder she had been  
gathering cherries. Her back was hurt. Just I arrived, I saw  
people of the life-saving service giving her medical care.

I was waiting behind a car which was going to leave the parking  
place, because I wanted to park my car there. Because of uncoming  
traffic I had to wait for a short time - another driver placed  
his car on the place.
My partner left me after we had been together for a long time.

At a discussion a friend took a "faschistic view", what I had not  
expected.

At a weekend's seminar my trousers suddenly burst, therefore I was  
prevented from participating in several activities.

I was driving my motorbike I went into a bend incautiously  
and fell down. I was slightly hurt, the motorbike was slightly  
damaged.

Before Christmas I got to know a girl but our relationshop could  
not consolidate before the holiday. Therefore it was a big  
surprise to get a carefully hand-made present from her. - Our  
relationship grew closer.

I was a child, I fell into a cellar (playing) and could  
be freed only with big difficulties.

I was angry about several drivers who showed an aggressive and  
dangerous driving habit.

Some time ago a girl tried to make me up without any action of my  
part. She used all possible means. Although I behaved refusingly  
she did not give up for a longer time.

I went to the sauna for the first time and there were men  
and women.

I was parking my car I was not cautious and bumped into  
another car. I caused considerable damage. The driver of the  
other car was very angry and I let him insult me because I felt  
guilty.

A person whom I had not seen for a long time called me and  
invited me for a party.

I was walking on the street, a group of drunk, bawling young  
people approached.

I was house-hunting: Another person got a flat that I would  
have liked, too, because he heaped a floot of words on the  
letter.

I shoplifted a pair of earrings from Coles and my Mum caught  
me with them in my bag.

my mother was tremendous on the phone and we talked for  
hours. She was in a good mood.

I saw a good male friend unexpectedly after a year, as I've  
just returned from overseas. I was feeling tired, looking a mess,  
and nervous.

After having left the company of someone who gave me a lot of  
support and made me laugh, found myself alone for days on end.

a boy had continued to use foul language and swearing in  
front of a group of my friends.

I was about seven or eight I was caught having stolen a  
doll's dress from my next-door neighbour.

Feeling guilt after greed, buying chocolate and pigging out to  
the point of feeling sick, especially as I am fat.
planning to marry.

No really strong such emotion. Just falling off to sleep I  
caught sight of a 5 cm diameter spider crawling onto the pillow  
beside me.

My feelings towards would-be in-laws for their participation in  
recent broken relationship.

Recent break-up of seriors long-term relationship, helped along  
by would-be  in-laws.

No very strong such emotion. Treatment of my sister by her  
dancing instructor - he is a "user", i.e., takes advantage of her  
good nature.

After failing a second attempt at Med 4, following a number of  
difficult personal circumstances.

Failure to complete medical course as a result of failing fourth  
year twice.

Wayne and Sue (close friends) were announced our guardians  
at ther wedding.

Car accident nearly occurred between us and drunk driver coming  
in opposite direction it missed us by approx 1 m and collided  
(after rolling twice midair) into nearby scrub.

On boat trip - saw mother giving young child (aprox 6-7 years)  
cigarettes.

in grade 3, late home from school every day for weeks  
because of harassment from a grade 7 boy I lied to mother about  
why I was home late.
Getting a part-time job.

Small car accident. Black ice on the road - cars in front of us  
started zig-zagging and so did we. Car in front did a 180¦ turn we  
followed and ended up in a gully.
People hunting animals.

my grandfather was sick, and died I felt more sad, though,  
he was sick.
People spitting in railway stations.
Falling over.

Eating too much I felt guilty afterwards because I knew I  
shouldn't have overeaten as I'm putting on too much weight.

my last year's second semester results came through - I was  
ecstatic.

I was sleeping in my room but woke in the middle of the night to  
think I could hear noises and see shadows moving. I felt that  
someone was in the house.

At school, a couple of years ago, a so-called acquaintance told lies  
about me to a teacher I was told about it by friends who overheard  
the conversation.

My grandfather died. He lived almost as a recluse not caring for  
himself as well as he should - Dad and we all helped as much as  
we could, but it didn't save him from himself. It was an  
unexpected death. His second de facto wife was lucky she wasn't  
jailed.

In my penultimate job I was responsible of a sections with  
several employers, after several years of dedication I was  
dismissed by a new chef, saying that I was incompetent.

I assisted to a scene where the police attacked a person that  
didn't have his documents. The savagery was too much, and the  
attacked person bleeded to much.
In a party of friends I got completely drunk.

Once in my homes yard, I was plaing football with my cousin and  
in a certain quick the ball went on uncontrolled putting down a  
bird-cage, killing it.
I had to assume a position which I didn't expect.

I was dismissed unjustly from the firm where I worked,  
because there where persons that didn't have problems, and  
wouldn't miss in the jobs they occupied if they were dismissed.

I felt very sad I had to give up something that by right was  
mine and although I didn't get it, a kind of suvenir that people  
don't give you the right to have.

The acts of brutal violence in generally disgusts me. Fights,  
phisical aggrssion, etc.

I felt ashamed in a certain occasion I had to read a text  
and didn't stop stuttering.
I was reproved eighth grade of high school.

I talked with a teacher yesterday who, to say the least, was  
rude and unwise and had irrelevant opinions about a friend.
The loss of the woman who loved me most till today.
I wanted to kiss a friend and didn't succeed, I felt shame.

On a telephone talk where I was agressive and stupid without the  
least, reason or better motive.

I succeed in writing something I felt and doing it I felt  
well and very happy for being able to express to myself something  
that was suffocating me.
I crashed my car.

in a difficult moment I couldn't express myself correctly  
and my thought came out with distortions bringing about highly  
negative and distorted results.

I heard about the death of somebody I liked very much and I  
was not present either to see the person or to try to share my  
emotions with other friends.

I saw a woman subjugated by money and not being able to hide  
how she hated herself for not having the will power to get out of  
such a situation because it was convenient, according to what she  
told me.

somebody suddenly said something (about me) at a wrong  
moment and I didn't agree (at that exact moment I was needing an  
extremely positive word).
my mother surprised me while masturbating.

I forgot to water the flowers in our flat and was rebuked by my  
friends who share the flat with me.

I was a child, I had a nightmare. At that time, I was not  
yet able to tell anybody about it, so I was very frightened. I  
could not explain myself all that and I had to deal with it by  
myself.

I was angry with a person who behaved terribly at a ball  
offending her relatives.

my grandfather died. I heard about his death, I had a  
bad feeling in my stomach and I felt as if I had lost something  
very precious.

Once I spoke without thinking very much - it was quite a  
nonsense.

I was not sure whether I should help an old woman going down a  
flight of stairs. I just watched her and saw how difficult it was  
for her to do it.

For about one year I had a rather bad relation with my father.  
Last Christmas Eve he invited me to stay withhim and I was very  
glad about it. It was a fine evening.

I live outside Graz - so I have to go by bus. One day I went home  
from the bus stop alone. It was dark, I had to go through a  
forest and there was a dark figure behind me. I was very  
frightened.

My sister had promised to help me to do a translation from  
English into German. But the day I needed her she told me that  
she was busy - I was very angry.

Several years ago my mother died. She had been ill for a long  
time, but nevertheless her death came unexpectedly. I did not and  
I still do not want to believe that it is true.

I have a horror of spiders and snakes. On a walk through the wood  
I saw the body of a slow-worm (without the head).

I came home from a party rather drunk. I said things I would  
never have said normally. Next morning I was terribly ashamed  
about what I had said.

An accident happened to my little cousin because I had not taken  
enough care of her. She fell on the floor and her hands were  
hurt.

I had a little cat which was very sick. As I liked it very much I  
went to a veterinary with it. He told me how to tend it and it  
really recovered its health. Everybody said that I had saved its  
life.

I was a child, I had a terrible nightmare with St. Nicholas'  
Devil Servant. I asked my mother if he really existed and she  
said yes. The following nights I could not sleep and a  
light had to be left turned on.

There was a time I did not get on well with my sister. I  
always grumbled at her and said bad things about her to my  
mother. So my mother always scolded her.

I was on a cave excursion with friends, I suddenly lost them  
and was afraid of losing my way in the cave.
I felt being treated unjustly by a teacher.
I was molested by an old drunk man.
I had drunk too much and nearly got an alcohol poisoning.

I went home alone early in the morning, I had to go through  
a wood.
my grandparents moved to another part of the town.

At the butcher's I saw an animal which had just been slaughtered;  
blood was dripping on the floor.

Once I spent a night with a friend at the secondary school. We  
told each other horror stories and suddenly we heard uncanny  
noises. I was terribly frightened.

My friend was pregnant, but lost her child during the second  
month. I went to see her at hospital - she was crying. I felt  
very sorry for her.

After a party I spent the night with a friend. We both were  
drunk, the morning was disillusioning. A friend was me leaving  
the room and I felt shabby and immoral.

I had to take care of a neighbour's child. I did not look after  
it all the time and the child fell down and was hurt. I felt  
guilty.

A very good friend of mine had been away for three months.  
we met again, we ran up to each other and embraced.

One evening my father told me to go into the cellar and get him a  
beer. I was terribly frightened at the idea of a man sitting in  
the cellar and assaulting me. For my defence I took an empty  
bottle with me.

I had stolen a bottle of rum from a person who knows me well. He  
threatened to call the police if I did not pay 500 Shillings.

my uncle died I saw a funeral for the first time. All people  
stood around the open grave and cried.

At a party I met a girl who drew me to her, told me some nonsense  
and always wanted to kiss me.

I put my head into the pullover of a girl to see her breasts. The  
girl looked at me so that I felt ashamed.

One night I was lying in my bed awake but I had my eyes closed. I  
saw figures with terrible faces and black frocks bending over me  
and touching me. I opened my eyes but I could still see them. I  
had the feeling that somebody was in the room. It was terrible.  
Only I turned on the light I was able to go to sleep.

I had arranged with a friend to go with him to Carinthia by car.  
We had arranged a place where to meet. I was a bit late and my  
friend had left already. I had no money to go by train. I nearly  
started to cry because I was so angry - it was very important for  
me to go to Carinthia.

Our dog had to be shot because he had killed a roe. I liked him  
very much and so I could not resign myself to that. I hated the  
hunter who shot him.

I was sitting in a station-hall and watching a lavatory  
attendant. She was very dirty. She started to eat something out  
of a dirty cup - it must have been something like lard. Then she  
took some breadcrumbs out of the pockets of her apron and ate  
them. I had to leave - I felt like vomitting.

I had to go to the doctor's because of a veneral disease. I told  
the doctor that I must have been infected by my boy-friend. This  
was not true, but I was ashamed to tell the truth.

we were playing, I hurt my little sister, but towards my  
mother I did not admit that it was my fault.

My neighbour was not able to set his car in motion because it had  
snowed heavily. I helped him - he was thankful and invited me.

I was skiing with friends and they wanted to ski-jump. I did not  
want to be left behind, so I braced myself and followed them.

My cut was run over by a car. After searching for a long time I  
found her lying in a kerb. I was rather shocked and angry with  
the driver.

I watched a report about El Salvador on TV, I saw people who  
had been murdered by terrible methods.

At a cross-country race I wanted to take a short-cut (which is  
not allowed). I was caught and disqualified. All my friends had  
observed that.

During a discussion I reacted very aggressively and so I made it  
impossible to continue discussing.

I am discussing something with a person and I realize that  
the other person is thinking over her own argumentations instead  
of listening, I become angry.

we were on holidays my girl-friend had to leave me after 4  
weeks and I had to stay in Turkey for some more weeks because I  
had a job there.

I studied medicine for several semesters. I was always disgusted  
we had the dissecting-course. I cannot understand why some  
persons like this course.

Some time ago we had a tournament in our tennis-club. For  
tactical reasons I was chosen to play against a much weaker  
player than I am. Although it would have been enough simply to  
win the game, I defeated him extremely. This would not have been  
necessary.

I had a discussion with my girl-friend. After some time we  
started to quarrel and at least - to get the upper hand - I said  
that she was not as important to me as she might believe. Some  
time later I apologized for that.

On New Year's Eve I went in a disco with friends. I amused myself  
and got to know many other people.

I had to go to the dentist's. he touched my tooth with his  
drill, I was terribly aftaid of the pain I would feel any moment.

I was very hungry and just wanted to start eating a friend  
called me who usually talks for a long time. I was angry because  
I was prevented from eating.

My sister, whom I like very much, asked me for a favour which I  
refused her for some flimsy reason. Some time later I felt sorry  
for that and something like sadness.

On my way to a concert I went with a man who tried to molest me.  
At that moment I did not care much but now the impression fills  
me with disgust.

I asked my friend to come with me to a disco because I wanted to  
be with a person I know well. But I amused myself with  
others I let my friend sit alone, although I had asked her to  
come.

I called my little sister to make her pick up her toy from the  
floor. she still refused after I had asked her for the  
fourth time, we began to quarrel. At last the whole family was  
involved in this quarrel and trouble was brewing.

I had a singing-lesson, but I was not very good. The last  
exercise was singing scales. I did that very well and my teacher  
seemed satisfied.

A teacher wanted to instill a certain opinion and a certain  
behaviour into myself, what I refused. I was afraid I saw  
him.

A friend had promised to call me at a certain time. I expected  
his call impatiently but in vain.

Years ago on Christmas Eve I felt very sad because I realized for  
the first time how I missed my father who had died at Christmas  
Years ago.
A man whom I like, was drunk and tried to molest me.

It was the time everybody spoke about and discussed  
Hainburg. I was also asked for my opinion. I was ashamed because  
I had no firm view of the whole thing and therefor was not able  
to join the conversation.

I was on a concert-tour and therefor seperated from my  
boy-friend. But I needed warmth which was given by a male member  
of the orchestra. My feelings towards him were not very deep, but  
his feelings were. I felt guilty he said "I am not a  
radiator".

At about midnight I had to go by bike through Graz alone. On the  
whole it was a distance of several kilometers. A car followed me  
through the streets. Only I went into a one-way street the  
car disappeared. The rest of my way home I was very afraid.

I had cared for a horse for 2 years. One day it was sold and I  
cried for several days because I was so sad.

A friend of mine was telling jokes which I felt to be very  
disgusting, especially because I was eating.

At a carneval-party I smooched with a man - some days later I was  
rather ashamed for that.

By fun I had a tussle with my sister. Suddenly I obviously hurt  
her unintentionally - and she ran out of the room, crying.

During my first week in Graz I met a girl who I had got to know  
in the train from Amsterdam to Graz. Although I had considered  
her very sympathetic, we had seperated without changing our  
adresses.

Many years ago I saw the film "Psycho" by Hitchcock for the first  
time. I saw the film I was alone and afterwards I hardly  
dared to go to bed and hardly was able to sleep.

I had got a bad cold. My father said I must be crazy to go by  
motorbike at those temperatures. I answered him that I did  
not care about a cold, he said that if I did not care for  
anything I could leave him (it was for the second time he said  
something like that).

I was at home alone I realized that a young roe approached  
our house. I hid because I did not want to frighten it. It  
limped. Some time later, I thought that it had already run  
away, I saw it lying on our terrace. I came nearer and saw that  
it was terribly wounded. I informed the ranger who said that the  
roe must have been attacked by dogs. He had to shoot it.

Several years ago I stayed with friends in the mountains for one  
week. We lived in a hut and had to cook for ourselves. One day my  
friend did not succeed in preparing spaghetti. That dinner was  
terrible - nevertheless we all ate rather much and had an  
improper and unsavoury conversation.

I still went to primary-school, I went on a ski-trip with my  
family. After skiing we went to a restaurant for lunch. Suddenly  
my father said that he had forgotten something in the car. He  
gave me the key and asked me to go and get it. I had difficulties  
with the key which was already bent. I asked my mother to help  
me. she tried to turn the key it broke. We had no second  
key. My mother was blamed for all that and I did not say a word.

I was 8 years old my tonsils had to be operated on. This is  
not a complicated operation, but just before it started I was  
very afraid so that I will never forget it.

My parents are divorced, father pays alimony for me. Two years  
ago my sister who lives with father, suddenly asked mother for  
money. As she considered the amount of money my mother offered  
her too small, she brought an action against mother. I was  
terribly angry with my sister.

I arranged with a friend to go skating the next day. He asked me  
to wake him up by telephone at twelve o'clock because we had come  
home late in the morning. Next day I called him - he was not at  
home. As something like that had happened to me several times  
before, I came to the conclusion that one cannot rely on anybody  
and I felt very sad.
Whenever I see a spider or a snake I feel disgusted.

I had slept with a boy for the first time I felt ashamed for  
three reasons. First, because I was only 13 years old, second,  
because I did not really like him, third, because he had caught  
me napping.

I had been together with my boy-friend for two and a half years,  
he got to know another girl and not even tried to conceal  
that from me. I drew my conclusions and left him - I also felt a  
bit guilty for what had happened.

My boy-friend told me that he would take me to the training of  
the life-saving dogs.

I was in a dark cellar and saw a glowing red point. I thought  
that it was a person with a cigarette - but it was only the red  
switch.

A man treated his dog very badly - he insulted and beated him  
until the dog kept lying on the floor with his tail drawn in.
A horse which I had liked very much was taken away.

On TV I saw a report about church in Amerika. A priest was shown  
who was performing miracles in front of the camera - I felt  
disgusted.

I was a child, my uncle came to see us. I spit at him and  
ran out - I do not know the reason for that. My father came after  
me and insisted on my apologizing.

I quarreled with my boy-friend. He said it was unfair that I  
always started crying so that he had to give in.

I come home in the evening, the first thing I do is to sit  
down and smoke a cigarette. One day I found the flat in a totally  
desolate state. My girl-friend had wanted to tidy up but had not  
finished.

My son's mother told me that she wanted to move to Vienna and  
take the child with her. This means a rather long distance for  
me. My whole family was sad and dumbfounded so that my own  
feelings were intensified.

a very near person got into an awkward situation but showed  
only helplessness and indecision.

I spent an evening with my girl-friend. we wanted to go to  
bed I was totally drunk. Next morning I felt rather ashamed.

I threw away an object, which belonged to a friend, because I did  
not know what to do with it. My friend was very sad about that  
and I felt guilty.
After a long time I saw my boy-friend again.
My first public appearance in front of a rathe big audience.

I was angry about how the government acted concerning Hainburg,  
especially I saw a discussion about it on TV.
Death of my father
I got indecent offers.

I bought new skis; I was ashamed to tell the assistant that  
I am not good at skiing and therefor bought racing skis.

My schoolmates were teasing a pupil who was not able to defend  
himself very well; I should have taken his part.

Once I was playing table tennis I was already sure that I  
would win , but at last I lost the game.
My grandfather's funeral.

In cinema I saw a film which showed how a person was torn out his  
guts he was still alive.

I was sitting in a restaurant with friends. They asked me  
something which they thought I should know. Actually I know it,  
but at that time I was not able to remember it.

I had an appointment with a friend. I promised him to meet with  
him, but at last I did not without having informed him.

I had a psychical crisis, I met a girl, who told me that she  
had had almost the same problems and how she had finally overcome  
them.

I had climbed on a cherry tree alone and there was a thick  
caterpillar beside my fingers. I feel disgusted by caterpillars  
and snakes. I was terribly afraid of the caterpillar crawling on  
my fingers. Out of the fear I was almost unable to climb down.

A friend of mine told other people that I was a slattern (because  
of an occurence that had happened some time ago). I heard  
about that I was very angry.

My grandfather was seriously ill, he had only a few days left to  
live. I had always loved him, but never told him. I saw him  
for the last time, I had the feeling that I had omitted so many  
things I could not do again. - There was a fly sitting on his  
forehead and he was too weak to drive it away. I was very sad  
I saw that.

I was 6 or 7 years old, I pulled down the trousers of a  
friend because I wanted to know what she looked like. My mother  
watched that and (as a punishment) sent me into the house. We  
never spoke about that; I think it was as embarassing for her as  
it was for me.

I told my boy-friend, who loved me very much, that I wanted  
to put an end to our relationship. a long time before I told him  
that and also a long time after that I felt guilty, because I had  
hurt him so much.

Unexpectedly I met some persons who I like very much.  
Spontaneously they invited me and integrated me within their  
group, although it was late in the evening.

After a footballmatch I went home by car, a friend drove. I did  
not realize that he was drunk until we were in the car. He was  
madly racing. Several times we were in dangerous situations and I  
told him to be cautious, but he did not care.

A friend of mine uses butter instead of oil he is cooking. I  
am always angry about that, because it is an unnecessary luxury.  
Recently we both were cooking and he wanted to use butter again.  
I had already put the oil into the pan, he poured it out  
again and put the butter into the pan.

After some friends had come to see me. They had stayed for  
several days and we had got on very well. they had left, I  
had a feeling of emptyness.

I had a quarrel with a friend who lived with me in the same flat.  
He moved out. Before he went he invited me and some friends for a  
drink. At last he was totally drunk and smelled disgusting.
