Besides, he told lies about us and behaved as if he was to be  
pitied.

I went to see a friend. There were other people, too, and  
everybody brought some present. I was the onlyone who brought  
nothing. My friend was very hospitable and did not show anything  
- although I knew how he felt.

With a group of handicapped people we went to a party. we  
wanted to leave we were not able to find one of these people. I  
had told his mother that we would leave at 4.30 p.m., actually it  
was planned for 3.30 p.m. Therefore there was a delay.

I had a quarrel with my fiancT. he admitted his fault,  
everything was allright. It was then for the first time that he  
surprised me with coffee and cake and a bunch of flowers.

After my boy-friend had beaten me for the first time, I always  
trembled somebody knocked on my door or I heard steps  
coming nearer.

I had not eaten anything for 2 days to be able to pay the fine  
for my fiancT. But he stayed in another town and spent one  
thousand shillings in the restaurant during the same time.
I had to give up my love, because it did not work out well.
I was insulted without a reason by a drunk man.

I spied on my fiancT and was terribly jealous. Later I saw that  
there was no reason for that.

My sister had a daughter. I saw the baby for the first time  
through a pane of glass and she looked at me.

My mother, my sister and I were sitting in the sitting room and  
watching a film on TV. My father came home drunk and told us to  
turn off. we did not do that he switched off the fuse and  
started shouting. We were sitting in the dark and I was afraid  
that he would do us a harm.

I bought an aquarium which made me much pleasure. I was watching  
the fish my father came in and asked me how much I had payed  
for it. He said he would not pay for the current that it would  
require.

I was 9 years old, I got a cat, but after 3 days he died. I  
was very sad, because I had nursed him and taken him to the  
veterinary's - but in vain. Although I had had him only for a  
short time I had liked him very much.

I am left-handed. I attended the first form, we learned to  
write with pens. I smeared everything I had written. All my  
friends had written well and wanted to know why the teacher was  
looking at my note-book. I was ashamed.

I was 4, we spent our holidays at the seaside. My sister and  
her friend wanted to go to a bay on an undangerous way. I wanted  
to arrive before them and went on a shorter, but more dangerous  
way. I arrived, I found nobody there. I waited for a long  
time, but nobody came. On my way back I met my mother who had  
been searching for me desperatly. She did not scold me, but I saw  
how much she had worried (herself).

I was 17, I had a mystic vision. I melted into a dazzling  
light, which omitted perfect love. The physical experience became  
unimportant, I heard or saw the words "overcome egotism". The  
feeling of neutral remained for month after that experience.

we had swimming instruction, we had to take a header from  
the springboard. I usually refused to do that, but at least I was  
forced to.

I played in a chess championship, I was disturbed by other  
people. I asked them to be quiet, but in vain.
my flute-teacher was replaced by a new one.

I was a child, I was sometimes forced to eat things that  
disgusted me.

I shirked the gymnastic lesson I met the director of our  
school who asked me what I was doing.

I was in a situation which seemed hopeless for me, I moved  
back to my parents. For my father it went without saying anything  
(normally he ofter grumbles at me).

I lived in a flat with a couple. The woman was so jealous of me,  
that she sometimes had crying fits. Eventually her husband could  
not stand that any more and wanted to kill me.
Often a dog which is treated very badly by his owner comes to us.

After a pleasant evening with friends in my flat, one of them did  
not want to leave, because he wanted to sleep with me. He said  
that he had fallen in love with me, that he felt alone and so on.

I look up to my Karate-teacher. I came to a training lesson  
after I had not trained for one week, I was totally stiff. I was  
ashamed.

My sisters asked me to fetch them at a discotheque which is 5 km  
off. There was a thick fog and snowfall. There was not enough  
room in the car for all of them and they asked me to go there  
once again. I did not do that they had a way to make me feel  
guilty.
my mother kept me in leading-strings.
my father died.
I worked at the life-saving sevice and saw the first exitus.

Last year I went to see friends in Yugoslavia - two girls with  
whom I get along very well.

Before I went to the urologist's I was afraid for several  
reasons: because it was for the first time, because the medical  
check-up might be painful, because of the uncertainty and because  
someone had informed me about it.

My girl-friend did not understand me; I was angry with myself  
because I had problems we seperated - I could not resign  
myself to it.
A friend who was 22 years old died.

I was in the army, we got a certain dish for dinner that I  
do not like at all. We were not obliged to eat, but I was very  
hungry.
I had to pay a fine because of speeding.

A friend who was 22 years old, died of leukemia; I had not known  
that he was so ill and therefore had not cared.
we got a young dog.
I was afraid before I went to the doctor's.
I had an accident with damage to the car body.
My dog died of a cerebral tumor.

I worked at the life-saving service I was disgusted by a  
patient whose outward appearance was distasteful.

I was a child, I had a medical check-up. I had to undress  
myself and was examined by several doctors.

I heard that a good friend, who had been abroad for a long  
time, would come and see me.

I heard friends grumbling at me in an adjoining room, although  
they had behaved in a friendly way I was present.

I read about a murderer who brutalized his victims by cutting  
open their stomaches and taking out their bowels.

I was a child: I had told my mother a lie and she found it  
out.

My father had been alone for a long time because my mother and  
sister were on holiday. I had not seen him for a long time and  
I finally called him I realized that he had been very sad  
about that.
I unexpectedly got a present from my father.

I had to go through lonely streets in the middle of the  
night.

My boy-friend had promised me to come home at about 10 p.m. He  
did not return until midnight and had consumed a lot of alcohol.
A relative, whom I like very much, left for the United States.

I was walking on the street, I slipped on the dung of a dog.  
I did not fall down, but I felt disgusted by the bad smell on my  
sole.

Some persons, who are important for me, came to see me and I had  
not washed the dishes.

I was looking after my cousin's little daughter; she fell down,  
was slightly injured and cried vociferously.

I met again a very good friend whom I had not seen for a long  
time.

I got lost in a foreign town. I did not know the language of that  
country and it took me hours to meet my friends again.

A friend had promised to get me a book which was very important  
for my work, but she forgot it.

My dog, whom I had had for eleven years, died. I watched his  
soporification.

A drunk man bumped into me and wanted to grip me. Fortunately I  
was able to break loose.

I stayed on a nudism beach, a man was watching me in a  
disagreeable way. I had the feeling that he was examining my  
body.

I had a quarrel with my father. He was depressed, because  
somebody had treated him injustly. As we had an argument, it was  
impossible for me to help him.

My friend came to see me after she had stayed abroad. I waited at  
the station.

After a motor accident (I was the frong-seat-passenger) I spit  
blood.

At an office an application that I had made was turned down  
because of a scrupulous interpretation of the rules.
My uncle died - I felt sad at the funeral.

I saw a drunk man tottering behind his wife and insulting her  
awfully.
I spread abroad an intimate secret.

I bought a Christmas present for my girl-friend. On my way home I  
was really glad about having found such a suitable thing.

My fear appeared in the form of jealousy. I was afraid that my  
girl-friend had fallen in love with another man, I was afraid to  
lose her.

I was angry I watched a ski-race. All the Austrian skiers  
dropped out.

During my holiday I met again a friend who had tried to commit  
suicide. She had just left hospital, her lips were trembling, she  
looked miserable.

On my way home in the middle of the night I saw a drunk man and a  
woman who were quarreling, beating each other, shouting and so  
on. I felt disgusted especially because they treated each other  
in such a degrading way.

My girl-friend and I live in one flat with another couple. We get  
along very well and usually we share everything. Once we two were  
sitting in our room and eating a cake the others came in.

I was on a visit to friends who have a baby. The baby was crying  
in another room, but soon it became quieter and it seemed that it  
would fall asleep. I went into the room where the baby was lying  
- and it started crying again.

I went to fetch my girl-friend at the station. the train  
arrived and I saw her descending and running up to me, I felt  
glad.

I wanted to go into a house, there was suddenly a big dog  
standing beside me. It was hardly moving, but I did not know how  
it would react later on.

My father had bought too many goods for his shop, there was not  
enough space to store them.
A friend died of cancer he was 18 years old.

At a party I saw two persons having a fight. The aggressions and  
the hate between these persons produced an unpleasant impression  
on me.

During a discussion I said something rather stupid and  
unnecessary.

I was driving my car, I wanted to pick something from the  
floor of the car and drove into the guide-rail. I thought that I  
should not have done that and felt guilty.

I was awakened by a dream in the middle of the night. I dreamt  
that a stranger was in my house.

My boy-friend had promised me to come an 10 a.m. - he was 3 hours  
late.
I heard about a murder of a 16-year-old girl.

I was sitting in a restaurant with friends and I knew that in the  
meantime my girl-friend must have come to my flat and found the  
door closed.

It was only once that I really felt sad: at my grandfather's  
funeral (after a long time of suffering he had died of cancer).

3 years ago I served in the army. Once a collegue denounced me  
because of a delict, which is usually committed. I was arrested  
for 3 days. I still detest this man.

Once I went home totally drunk and roused all our neighbours from  
sleep.

After I had had a disappointment in my private life, my friend,  
who studies in Vienna, came to see me spontaneously.

A friend had promised me to give me a lift to Graz. To be sure I  
called her before we went. She told me that she had just promised  
another person to give him a lift.
I am sad because some relations to friends are not very good.

I think I have hardly had a situation where I felt disgusted.  
Perhaps once, I saw a big spider.
my boy-friend left me and I wanted to persuade him to stay.
Seeing relations from overseas after a few years.

Unknown person knocking repeatedly on backdoor no one else  
was at home.

Accidentally seeing a friend in a compromising situation with a  
stranger.
Parents finding out I smoked.
Not thanking relatives for a favor done.
Emotional reassurances by spouse.
Movement in bush late at night while camping.
Heated discussion with spouse concerning new house.
Loss of close relative.
The price I was charged for work on my car.
Caused fault in V.C.R. by not following instructions carefully.
Losing my temper with my spouse.
A night spent with a group of friends.

A car came very close to hitting me whilst I was crossing the  
street.

A friend whom I had gone out of my way to do something for did  
not bother to acknowledge my efforts, and treated me badly  
thereafter.

A friend once reacted childishly (he is 23 yearrs old) to my not  
responding in his favour to a request, that is: he asked me for  
some money I refused, and his reaction was quite childish.

I borrowed money from a friend and did not pay back the debt  
I said I would.
Getting a phone call from a very old friend.
Before giving a seminar to a rather large audience.

Being stopped by the police for a traffic offence which I don't  
think I committed.
Death of a parent.

At a social event none of the guests would help to serve  
food or clear tables. It was all beneath them.

The mother of a small child found me shaking the child in  
exasperation, because I couldn't get it to sleep.

I was a passenger in a jumbo-jet which was accelerating down the  
runway and almost at the point of take-off, the pilot  
suddenly braked and put the engines into reverse thrust, in an  
obviously urgent attempt to stop the aircraft. The hostesses show  
signs of concern and my first thought was that something was on  
the runway in our path and that we were in danger of hitting it.

A person walking his dog allowed it to defecate on the footpath  
outside my house. Although it had happened before, this was the  
first time I had witnessed it. All the skills I had learnt from  
PY 263 were thrown out the window his indifference to my  
protestation was obvious to me.

While walking through an old mining area, I unwittingly disturbed  
a wallaby which, in its resultant flight, accidentally fell down  
a deep mine shaft. On investigation it seemed uninjured, but it  
was impossible for the wallaby to get out, and also for me to get  
it out of the shaft. To prevent its suffering a slow death, I  
shot it.

A colleague and I were sitting on a bench next to an old man in a  
shopping centre. the old man coughed and spluttered somewhat,  
then with his fingers removed the resultant phlegm and mucous  
from his mouth, and transferred it onto the armrest of the  
bench.

I had promised to contact a friend about a particular matter by a  
certain date, then thought no more about it until the friend  
reminded me after the date had passed.

A neighbour complained about smoke from my backyard incinerator  
entering his house after a change of wind direction. I lit the  
fire after originally checking that the wind would not blow the  
smoke in that direction.

I heard that there had been some women raped at uni, just  
near where I usually park my car and walk by myself at night.  
Although I wasn't in danger it unnerved me for days and I was  
fearful whenever walking through the area.

the person I am going out with let me down in a situation  
that I was depending on them, and didn't show respect or care.

I found out that a person I went to school with had died in  
a car accident.

I heard about the way a parent of a friend had mistreated  
him, and caused a great instability.

I realised that I had become too emotionally involved with  
the person I'm going out with, and I began to like someone  
else and questioned whether I really care about person I'm with.

I came very late one night (or morning !) and my parents  
were waiting, not so much angrgy as disappointed.

One of my friends and I had breakfast in a restaurant. It was  
spontaneous and lots of fun.

I was walking home late at night from lectures and someone  
deliberately started following me. It was dark and I was scared.

At one of my close friends saying she didn't like the way I am  
nice to people I don't know, or who have been nasty to me.

Leaving Melbourne to move interstate - leaving relatives and  
friends behind.

Disgust at a girl I know for continually feeling sorry for herself  
and never acting positively to do something about her problems.

I am ashamed of the horrible way I used to treat my little  
sister.

I noticed that Meryl Streep and I had similar cheekbones and jaw  
structure.
I do not recall being scared in the near past.
As for disgust.

Girl I was fond of did not initiate conversation as I expected in  
tutorial.

I realised that someone was insidiously attempting to shit me off  
I was disgusted with him for doing so, because I afforded him  
with no excuse to do so.

I do not seem to feel emotion such as shame, guilt or fear - far  
out !

I cannot recall feeling guilty in the near past.
REMARK - SUBJECT MAY NOT HAVE TAKEN THE EXERCISE VERY SERIOUSLY.
I was complimented and called "delightful".
Anger towards my lover for being late.
The death of my twin sister - suicide.

Disgust with myself for consistently making foolish errors in  
communicating with others (asking for 1/2 Kg of nuts I only  
wanted 50 g).

I had been rude to my mother at a time she needed  
comforting, not anger (death of my sister).

Guilt - because I had not written to my sister for months before  
she died.

My current lover and I had been very busy with work and study and  
had not had time alone together for almost a month until one  
afternoon recently we made love for hours and then showered  
and ate together.

A workmate and I had been antagonistic with each other for some  
weeks - he had reacted violently to my criticisms of his work  
standards.

I had been having a heated argument with a lover - whose  
intention was that we should marry in the near future - and was  
rejected by her I started to cry. I stopped crying for  
a moment she said "There, have you got it all out now ?".

I discovered some pornographic literature in a workmates drawers.  
The literature featured pictures of naked women defecating on one  
another.

Upon returning from a journey of about two weeks duration, I  
found that a collection of pornographic literature had been  
removed from my room I had previously thought that no one was  
aware of the existence of this material.

My mother and father had forbidden me to ride my scooter on the  
road, and I had transgressed (together with the "wild" kids from  
across the street) by riding my scooter down a steep hill near  
our house. My mother sent the boy next door to collect me, and I  
was severely scolded.
Blank.

After going through a glass door, I sustained a number of serious  
cuts which were gaping open.

The mother of a person with whom we had been sharing a housing  
accused me of trying to rip her off over payment of bills in the  
house.

Watching "11 am". They had a programme on the starving refugees.  
Their plight was a source of sadness for me.

A girl whom I hadn't seen for a period of time told me that she  
had been pregnant and had an abortion - I was the father.

Disgust with oneself after being intoxicated enough to go to bed  
with a stranger.

I feel shame every time I think of very dear friends of mine  
abroad who were family to me for a year, and now 2 years later, I  
have attempted, but have not actually gone through with  
corresponding with them, to express my feelings and gratitude.

I thought that my high school love and I had a mutual  
emotion.

I was on my surf ski. Rather large waves to strong current  
separated me from my ski and we both began to drift slowly  
(actually rather quickly) away to sea. The direction I was  
drifting in was taking me straight over a reef on which rather  
large sharks were constantly being caught. (I was alone with no  
one to help me).

I was enneutraling the company of bird life while I was eating lunch  
in a park a group of people began throwing sticks at some of  
the birds - for no reason other than the satisfaction of seeing  
them being scared away.

I left my sister's house after staying there for a few days.  
She has two little boys, and they are very warm people (the  
family). At the time, I was in need of this sort of contact, and  
I grew very fond of children (no, I'm not a paedophiliac).
my father revealed inconsistent morals.

I woke up after a night of drinking I couldn't remember and  
discovered several untoward things had occurred.

Leaving home my mother thought I had no reason to go and  
felt that I was rejecting her. She is a constantly depressed  
person (a bit of a worry-wort) and I felt guilty about having  
given her this additonal problem.
I'd just got the top mark in an exam.

I was at the corner shop, which I patronise regularly I had only  
a $ 50 note and I purchased about $ 3 worth of goods that I  
really needed - the keeper made sarcastic remarks to others about  
people using him to cash notes.

My mother died of cancer after a 4 year illness - I think the  
most pregnant moment of sadness was the next morning, just as the  
sun rose.

I was walking outside the union refec after rain I tripped  
and fell.
I stole 5c from my mother's purse for a choo-choo bar - I was 6.

On a sailing boat at night, under a full moon, listening to Pink  
Floyd, drinking good wine, with good company, the boat being  
steered by autopilot, and a full eclipse of the moon.

my rights to use a shared house had been usurped by  
co-owners out of pure selfishness.

At rejection / being ignored by a loved person held in great  
esteem.
Viewing the nuclear war film "Threads".

Following heavy stirring / ridiculing a close friend who was  
very vulnerable to such attack - inspiring fierce, defensive  
counter-attack.

Guilt at having pressed another person to expose/explore his  
personal weaknesses/faults, to the extent that the other person  
was made to feel terrible/defensive.
Family member survived an operation.

I was walking to my car at night and thought that I was being  
followed.

I walked in on a teenage patient of mine (I work in a hospital)  
as he was going through my office drawers and he had removed  
money from my purse.
I became aware that an acquaintance had stolen from friends.
Caught cheating on a diet.
I had shown anger toward my dog and he was killed later that day.
A close married friend has just had his first child.

Stranded in the north of Fraser Island with a submerged 4 WD hire  
vehicle.

At the funeral of a friend about 20 years old, who was killed in  
a hit-and-run motorcycle accident.

A female friend was violently ill on the return journey from a  
wedding reception we attended. Getting her out of the car  
home took quite a while.
Cheating in a minor geography exam at school.
Having received an offer to do post-graduate work.

Taking a trip to crocokile country I fell out of the boat and was  
motivated by fear of being eaten to perform great swimming feats.

Last night - finding that someone in the house had eaten an  
entire packet of almonds I had bought for a family treat.

The loss of my father as he died of a massive and sudden heart  
attack.

Having had a very heated argument with my sister - I began  
hitting her about the head with a newspaper I was holding.
A situation where I stole a friends wife's wallet.

Winning a tight tennis match. One set to play, and the team was  
behind by 3 games. We won the last set 6-2 and won the match by a  
game.

at school, I threw a duster at another child and hit him in  
the head. The blow caused a flesh wound and I was afraid of what  
would happen to me the teacher found out the circumstances.

Finding that a subordinate at work was still not willing to  
cooperate after discussions to try and resolve an attitude  
problem.
Death of the family dog.

We had friends to dinner and one of them threw a beer bottle in  
the air, and it bounced on an expensive table and damaged the  
table .The person did not apologise.

After making a joke about a friend's marriage that was too  
personal.

Carried out a vandalistic act on some windows at an old army  
location.

Arriving in New Zealand as a teenager - first overseas trip -  
something "exhilarating" about the change of scenery etc.

As a child (i.e. 5-7) hiking in reasonably rugged bush and  
becoming lost for a duration of 5-7 hours.

Leaving the house myself and a female friend had shared for 6-8  
months because of the friendship which developed and our approach  
to each other in occasional instances of several personal crises.

Discovering a good friend had lied to me, resulting in a  
detrimental relationship with another person.

No specific instances - perhaps having lied as a child resulting  
in someone else being blamed for the event.

Going to a friend's wedding and seeing many of my old friends  
whom I had known before I moved to a new district five years  
previously.

Car accident. Travelling as a passenger along narrow bitumen road  
at night - trying to overtake semi-trailer. The truck pulled over  
onto our side and we hit the wet dirt, swerved back into the  
truck, back onto the verge, over a guide post and into a ditch.

At school I had a shouting argument with a friend over my  
ability to carry out a particular duty in the correct way without  
harming her.

Looking up end-of-semester results, and finding I'd failed three  
out of seven (subjects).

I found out some family friends were embezzelling the  
company they worked for - using company petrol and food supplies  
and claiming furniture and crockery.

my best friend foud out I'd been lying about something I'd  
been doing behind her back.

After having told an authority figure a very large lie I was told  
she believed me, because she believed I had never lied to her.

After being away on a holiday for 2 months, a friend, who lived  
interstate, had remembered I'd get back and phoned to  
welcome me home on the night of my arrival.
Walking along with a dog barking at you and following you.

Doing a group assignment and being left to do all the work and  
take the blame for any mistakes.

After training for an Australian championship competition for a  
year and then injuring myself 2 weeks before the competiotion.
Someone ruining someone's property just for the fun of it.

A friend giving me an expensive Christmas gift while I gave her a  
cheap one.
Talking about someone behind their back.

I was captain of the school swimming team. The team was only two  
points in front before the last relay. We won the relay, which I  
swam in, and thus my team won the championship.

I was in about Grade 7, I came home from school one day and was told  
that my mother had skin cancer and would have to go to the hospital  
straight away.

Shifted from Melbourne to Brisbane. All my old school friends  
gave me a party and I had to say good-bye to them all.

Was picking up my father from work and on passing through the  
Valley watched three prostitutes walk up and down waiting for  
someone to pick them up. Clothing was disgusting.

Had a very good friend. We grew apart I found myself running her  
down to other friends.

Guilt after fighting with my sister (for) telling her how bad she  
was.

I won the "Under 18" Showjumping at the Brookfield Show. The  
competition was very stiff and there were many riders competing.

I was on holiday, walking back to where I was staying, at  
night, and two men started closely following me. There was nobody  
around that I could run to.

my mother and father split up I was angry: I felt deprived  
and "different" from other children at school.

I was terribly upset my kitten got hit by a car. He didn't  
die, but for several weeks we thought he might have to be put  
down.

I heard that one of my good friends, at a party, had  
got herself involved with some very undesirable characters and  
was experimenting with drugs.

I hadn't studied for an exam, so I pretended to be sick so I  
wouldn't have to go to school. I lied to my mother - she realized  
I had been lying she got home from work and found that I had  
been over to a friend's place.

I was young, I stole some money from my mother's purse. It  
wasn't very much, but I can remember she found it gone I  
felt very guilty.
Day I received my T.E. score and acceptance into my chosen course.

At a school dance my supposed "best friend" kept walking  
away from me whenever I came near her.

At end of school - function to "celebrate" ? Leaving friends who  
I'd known for up to 12 years.

While watching a film of an experimental operation on a cat's  
brain in which the cat had metal pieces protruding from its eyes,  
mouth etc. to keep the head stable while being cut open.

my mother asked me to do a job for her which does not  
require much effort on my part, yet I refused for selfish reasons  
and saw her have to do it.

After having been told not to take the car, I took it anyway and  
felt guilty about having taken it.

Eating biscuits and drinking Milo (Chocolate energy drink made  
with milk and usually drunk warm) with my friend at College. We  
get on really well, don't withold any feelings about each other's  
friends and are pretty good at cheering each other up we are  
homesick.

Going to a disco by myself to wait for some friends. We had  
separated and hadn't planned where to meet. I wasn't sure if they  
were even going to this place so I felt very conscious of being  
alone.

A person ignored my advice, did not pay any attention to what was  
saying. She acted as though I wasn't even there. We were doing  
group work so everybody had the right to speak yet she just  
ignored me. She made me feel insignificant.

A friend of mine is having psychiatric problems because of his  
mother's death ages ago. He is really quiet and because it  
relates back to his childhood I feel sadness for him. He doesn't  
lead a normal life and it just seems unfair.

At school, the only thing people my age could think of was getting  
rolling drunk. They couldn't have a good time without firstly  
getting drunk.

A girl I was with yelled something out to this group of guys I  
knew. It sounded really childish.

I didn't tell my parents exacly what had made me so late in  
getting home one night. I left out some details and somehow, I  
felt I had lied to them.

Getting a good mark for a subject I had worked hard at but  
expected only a moderate mark.

cleaning up a pile of junk under our house, a huge spider (a  
"Jungle Spider") ran out near me. (I do not like even small  
spiders).

At the hardware store, trying to convert Imperial to Metric  
measurements, I made a mistake, and didn't buy enough tiles for  
the bathroom. I was angry at myself, because I hope to be a Maths  
teacher.
My father died last year after an 8-week severe illness.

During the PY 102 film session on Tuesday, one of the films shown   
was of an experiment on a live cat involving strapping it into a  
machine for possibly days, and doing things to its brain.

Several years ago I was caught riding the train without a ticket.  
The station-mistress treated me like a criminal almost.

I was walking quite quickly and unthinking through a children's  
playground, a toddler ran in front of me I knocked him over  
and he hit his head quite hard and began crying.

I got a good reaction from my tutor and tutorial group for a  
presentation I'd given that I was very worried about.

A man was yelling outside my window at 3.00 am, yelling threats,  
though not to me.

Going away for the weekend, leaving my College room open - I  
returned several friends had had a party there, leaving the mess.
Passing away of my father.

At a party where the boys were telling revolting stories about  
the girls they'd been with.
Getting slightly intoxicated at the 1984 I.C.C. Ball.

I felt guilty about going out I should have been studying  
for a presentation I had to give on Wednesday the next week.

I received the mark well above requirements for the course I  
wanted to enter, yet I was not accepted - anger at the injustice  
of it, because I didn't receive early release of H.S.C. marks.

I left all my friends at school (break up) knowing we would  
probably all go our separate ways, and none see one another for a  
long time.

At my father, he yelled and accused my sister's friend (over  
the phone) of doing something he didn't do, or know anything  
about.

I was little and didn't own up to placing a lolly on the  
varnish, this pulled it all off and I didn't admit my guilt.

At the tender age of eleven a friend and I left a party and  
proceeded to walk through dark and secluded streets of a bad  
neighborhood to find a telephone (recent spate of Horror Movie  
watching had occurred).

In a situation whereby a friend's actions were deliberately  
against my wishes and (with) no regard to my feelings.

A situation where I ignored my beliefs and principles for a trip  
of whimsy.

I bacame involved with a boy for a very brief moment not because  
I liked him but because I needed some sort of company. The  
consequences weren't as I expected and caused me much shame.
Ignoring my parents'wishes.
Having my luggage checked at Customs.
a friend wouldn't speak to me and wouldn't tell me why.
Thinking about friends overseas.
Hearing of a filthy situation over the phone.
Sending pictures home I'd put on so much weight.
Borrowed someone else's towel without asking.

I opened my TE Score envelope, and saw I got into  
Physiotherapy.
I was bringing in the shopping and nearly stood on a snake.
I was accused of "bitching" about best friend.

At our Senior dinner - separated from school friends, nothing  
will ever be the same again.
At a night club watching little tarts trying to earn a living.

I was little - Mum caught me telling a lie about who broke  
the cup.

I used to tell Mum I was going somewhere else than where I  
was (going).
I was caught in an elevator and it got stuck between floors.
I was put into a tennis team below my standard.
my father died.

I have seen people very drunk and making fools of  
themselves.
my friends were rude to a girl.
I was rude to my mother and got angry with her.

somebody broke into our home one night my mother was  
out, and my sister and I had just gone to bed.

my sister lost my favourite jumper at a party and failed to  
tell me for several days after it happened.

my father passed away of cancer, I was extremely saddened.  
He was not very old, which made matters worse. The actual death  
was horrendous, but the moving funeral saddened me more so.

I ate 12 biscuits one night after tea while watching TV - I don't  
know why.

I was seven years old and swimming outside the flags at the Gold  
Coast. I was caught in a rip and taken out about 100 m. I  
couldn't swim too well, but an older friend (17) swam out and  
saved me.

While at school I had to write an essay for doing something wrong  
that I didn't do. I wrote the essay about how I was mistreated and  
got Saturday morning detention along with a few other kids, but  
they didn't show up.
one of my closest friends died unexpectantly.

I saw a male engineer one year and came back to find he was  
now a female (I don't know it/them personally).

We owned a shop and I used to serve in it occasionally. We  
sometimes took lollies out of the stand and Dad caught me one  
day.
Lying to a friend about something that was trivial.

I had promised to do a task for someone that was close to me, and  
from the outset I knew it was important that I do it, but it  
came to it, I let them down.
Good news about a sick relative.
Walking in the dark by myself.
Getting terrible meals, but paying heaps for them.
felt lonely about writing my family.
Person talking about a situation while eating.

Felt it after I spoke terribly (got mad at) the person who is the  
most important in my life.
Not giving up something for Lent.
Every time I see a spider or a snake.
The first time I left home.

On a camp - boys and girls in one cabin. One guy forced himself  
upon another girl and was having intercourse, while the girl in  
the bunk beneath was pretending to be asleep and not be ill.
my new jeans split while I was with the youth group.

I was 17, I told Mum I came in at midnight, really it  
was 3.30.

Can't remember specific event - besides just being moderately  
happy until a year or so ago.
Left alone in dark young.
Can't remember exact example.
Close relative is dying of cancer - found out last week.

Doctors ignored relative who complained about pain, and is now  
dying of cancer.

One of my best friends'fiancT broke off the relationship because  
his feelings for me were stronger than for her. I felt the same  
for him, but did not really encourage him to leave her or stay  
with her - still felt shame.
After the fact that made me ashamed I felt sadness.

A person that eat half of a cockroach in a cake without knowing  
it.

A situation where we were the center of attention, and things  
happened without my control on them, that showed our disagreement,  
and ignorance.
I let a person assume a fault that I committed.

finally I found a place to live, I felt relieved, predicting  
changes in my life, and I became happy.
I dreamed that I was being attacked by a friend.
I was left by the person I loved without any reason.
To fight with a sister and to know that she doesn't care.
To be kissed by soembody I didn't expect to.

A day I was getting out of the shower I covered only the  
front part of my body with a towel (I was 7 years old), and I  
didn't see that my cousin was in the room.

I finished a love affair where I was responsible of the sad  
end.

I felt fear once I was asleep and dreamed that I was dying  
asfixiated by a cardiac attack, I was afraid and woke up  
desperate. Altough I wasn't afraid of death I was afraid.

I feel it I see that somebody is traying to made a stupid of  
me.

I felt it I was at home and saw a discussion without sense  
between my parents.

I see all the putridness of people. The fact is the catarrh  
and spits that whash the streets of S.Paulo.

I almost drowned myself in the municipal swimming pool that  
I use to go almost not excaping.
The death of my grandfather.

To go through the underground way at suburb station of LAPA. Poor  
people and the ambulants badly dressed up in a passage badly  
kept.
I pointed a failure of a friend of mine.
I met a friend that I hadn't seen for some time.
I got in jungle where there was a great number of snakes.
an unknown person provoked me verbaly and physically.
my team lost a championship.
A dirty person, smelling bad and unknown laying on me.
I confused a girl with another.

Once I complained I caused a great discussion between my  
parents.

I began to date a boy with whom I am till now. This was 16  
months ago.
I got separated from the man I loved.

An acquaintance of mine revealed himself in a light unexpected to  
me.

I was in a sanatorium. In front of me a boy fell down from his  
invalid's chair. I could help him but I didn't. I felt like being

I was to sit for my first entrance exam. I had fear of a  
possible failure.

I was indignant at the unimpartiality shown by the referees at  
the football match between Bulgaria and France.
I got separated from the man I loved so much.

I was watching some scenes from the Bertoluchi's film  
"Twentieth Century".

I have sometimes been unfair to my parents, I have  
happened to deceive them over some trifling things.
I come home late at night.
I talk to silly, petty-minded and unmanageable people.
my friend (girl) went abroad for two years.
I happen to witness some sadistic acts.
I have a plain appearance.
someone is accused or punished instead of me.
I was bitten by a dog.
My grandfather's funeral.
I was alone at home on New Year's Eve.
I was on a walk with my child I met a drunk woman.
I was unaware that I had walked the streets in torn trousers.

Once I worked as a designer. A fitter was hard hit in a damage  
that occurred at the building site I had designed.
A grenade blew out next to me.
An unjust calumny concerning me.
Unrealisation of the desired profession (aviator).
Disgust with a subordinate.
I lied to a friend.
Betraying someone's trust.
Friend's fiancT left her for me.
Winning Queensland Chess Championship.

in a car accident where car was total wipe off (wipe out, or  
write off).
With self at losing an important game that I should have won.
Death of grandfather (unexpected).

Someone smoking on Electric train (Electric trains are  
non-smoking) with alcohol smell coming from person.
bathing at surf beach & lost togs.

Receiving a very personal letter from a lady that I like, which  
revealed that she was more enthusiastic about me than I had  
thought possible.

I left my home in Melbourne to come to Q'land to study and before  
I hopped in the car I hugged my mother and shook hands with my  
father. Sensing immediately my father's sadness, I also had a  
flood of the same emotion.
one of my parents verbally, personally abused the other.

I felt something akin to shame after a heavy night of drinking,  
along with waking up with a woman I had just met whose husband  
was an epileptic. I was later to know that she knew my mother.

I felt guilty about talking negatively, and agreeing with a  
person who was doing likewise, about a non-present third person.
Being in love for the first time.

As a child - stepping on a rusty nail - being told that I might  
get tetanus.

As a child - about 8 years old - walking across a paddock - being  
set upon by another boy who claimed it was "his land" - being  
intimidated by the boy - crying, being punched, etc.
As a child - having a dog - it getting a disease and dying.

As a child - being sent to the shop by mother - buying some  
chocolate - getting caught by mother.

As a child - accidentally stepping on a pet guinea-pig - it  
dying.

One night going downstairs, and hearing a strong stirring of  
brances, which was not the wind.

I was informed by my flatmate that, we'd moved into our  
flat, she'd expected us to buy our food separetely - this event  
actually happened some 5 months after our sharing began. Prior to  
this, she had said nothing.

Having to decide on a termination of a pregnancy, after  
discussing it with friends, family and the man involved.

a friend didn't invite her own parents to her Graduation  
ceremony.

Saying something quite rude, but in jest, about a photograph of  
someone, but it didn't quite turn out that way.

I was about 14 years old, I "borrowed" a can of drink from  
the refrigerator, intending to replace it later that day. But it  
was found missing before I could do anything - no one owned up to  
its disappearance.

I was a child, my beloved cat gave birth to four beautiful  
little kittens. Before she had them, she came up to me and I  
followed her out, then witnessed them being born.

Upon moving away from home for the first time to a different  
city, I felt no longer "under the wing" of my parents even though  
they would always be there to help me. I felt a sense of loss, I  
was now all alone in the world, responsible for my own actions.

I was sitting at a rock concert, listening to an extremely loud  
band. A tiny baby in a crawler had been left by his young mother,  
right out in the sun next to a speaker, and was screaming -  
probably in pain.

Because I was lazy and unthoughtful I did not get into contact  
with a very close friend she shifted from the Gold Coast to  
Brisbane, for a month, despite her efforts to contact me. I felt  
shamed I finally confronted her again.

Before Uni started, I had to leave home and take up residence in  
Brisbane (the "big smoke") leaving home, my family, and moving to  
such a big place was quite intimidating at first, and I was  
anxious about it.

A very close friend from Victoria visited me over the holidays.  
Having enneutraled his company immensely over 10 short days, I was  
overwhelmed by sadness he left to return to Victoria.

One of my flatmates and I came back to the flat Monday morning,  
to find a real Mess, left by the guy we share with.

First weekend back home after one week at Uni I scolded one of my  
sister's best friends for using our telephone. Very silly, but I  
was annoyed because she was there at a time I needed to be  
with my family.

neutral of giving birth, and of sharing that neutral with my husband.  
Moments of complete happiness and feelings of so much love.

Attempted rape by 5 guys - held my arms behind my back and  
molested me, constantly threatening to beat me. Penetration did  
not occur as the driver of the car stopped that.

Anger at doctors for their treatment of me after giving birth.  
They left part of placenta behind and I bled heavily for twelve  
weeks - due to this, I felt weak and emotional, and they said I  
needed psychiatric treatment and give me no support.

my son was diagnosed as having CEREBRAL PALSY, at age 5. He  
would have to endure so much labelling, stigma and discrimination,  
even though his case was relatively mild.

I have an adopted Aboriginal sister I felt disgust due to the  
racism she has been subjected to.
I can't remember ever feeling shame.

I decided my first marriage had ended, and left with the  
child. I felt overwhelmed by guilt as I was separating mother and  
child.

Receiving notification that I had made a successful application  
to the Speech Therapy course at Uni, gave me a very good feelig  
of achievment and neutral.
Not included on questionnaire.

My mother left my father for his best friend, and he moved to  
Papua New Guinea. Despite the fact that I am closer to my father  
than to anyone else in my family, I had to move in with my  
mother, and say good-bye to my father, not knowing I would  
see him again.

I discovered my mother had been having an affair with my  
father's best friend, and then ran away with him without even  
speaking to me about what she was doing letting me come home from  
school simply to find her gone. I was filled with disgust and  
contempt.

I once stole a shirt from the Department Store in which I work. I  
have been promoted to work in a very privileged section of the  
store. Their belief in my integrity makes me feel even guiltier.

Seeing a close friend who had just returned from twelve months  
overseas.

Finding myself alone in a public toilet block with a man known to  
have had great psychological disturbances.

After seeing an "uncertain" child work on a model for several  
hours, I watched a "bully" of the same age destroy it, telling  
the child that it was worthless.

Viewing the results of senseless vandalism to a local primary  
school.

I slept with a man purely because I found him physically  
attractive and was under the influence of alcohol.

Inventing a fictitious series of events, as a result of which I  
ended up in a conflict with my two closest friends.

going for my driver's licence for the third time, because  
everything, it seemed, hinged on getting it. I was really nervous,  
and the testing Officer made me a little afraid as well. There  
were lots of things to worry about. I passed however.

a so-called friend let me down, she promised to tell me  
a certain concert was occurring, and that she'd get me  
tickets. I was really looking forward to it. She did nothing,  
just told me out of the blue one day what a fantastic concert it  
was going to be.

my family heard that my Mother's cousin who lives in  
England wrote us to tell that he had cancer of the lymph glands.

I found out how the people of Ethiopia were starving and  
their government was spending millions on celebrating being in  
power so many years. Then I saw all these people on TV needing  
food, etc.

I went to visit Montrose home for crippled children to interview  
a handicapped child. I interviewed two boys and it went really  
well. I promised I would visit them, but never got the time. Now I  
hope they've forgotten me, but I feel ashamed of letting them  
down.

I was driving my parents' car into a carpark in front of a shop  
we own, and scraped the corner of the front panel on the back  
corner of my father's utility. I didn't tell anyone, I lied about  
the bump (later I had to confess).

One day in a crossroad somebody crashed my car. I got out and  
this person laughed at me. I felt such a great anger that I got  
in my car and went away.

Returning home in the late afternoon I saw an indecent act made  
by a man with the purpose that I saw it.

In a school parting we agreed to go to a restaurant.  
We met at school and we separated us in several cars. My car  
broke and we arrived late. All those who already had arrived  
stand up and applauded us we entered two hours late.  
All the restaurant attention was turned on us.

One night I and my friends went to the cemetery. We stopped the  
car in front of the wall and suddenly the grave digger appeared  
over the wall looking like a ghost. I was already afraid and  
almost died.

one teacher unjustly gave me zero in a test saying that I  
was cribbing.

the teacher asked me to read my composition that was the

feel neutral for her mainly.

Motorcyclistic accident where for some minutes I didn't know if I  
was alive or dead, I remained "cold levered" during the situation  
but felt great fear.

I acted in a negative way at a certain moment by laziness  
to concede a moment of the time I thought to be my own.
I met my mother after months of absence.
I whatched a horror film on a Friday 13th.

Discussing with a certain person about a job I was getting and  
that perosn was negative and pessimistic.
I felt lack of aid from close friends.

I saw a fight I had a physical reaction of disgust and of  
deep perturbation.
Walking on the street passing by an air duct, my skirt went up.
Being disloyal with persons I loved.
I got a present from a great friend (a dog).

There was a scene of shooting in front of my house, I was very  
afraid. Two armed men confronting. I didn't discover the reason  
of the incident.

I was waiting to receive the participation on the profits and did  
not receive it.
I didn't get the job I wanted.

I went to eat at my aunt's house and she served macaroni with a  
horrible appearence. I felt the sensation above. The worst was  
that I was practically obliged to eat.

I saw my father coming out of the bathroom. He thought that  
he was alone at home and came out without his clothes.

I misled a person: I said that I would do her a  
favour and didn't.
I can see my parents because now I am far from them.
Once, during a performance I did not sing the way I had to.
I got separated from the woman I loved.
the Americans set their nucleaar missiles in Europe.

I don't say the truth, I don't do a certain thing  
thanks to my laziness.
Once I promised to do something but I didn't do it.
I was admitted to the Bulgarian State Conservatoire.
I am afraid if I'll finish the term.
I was angry my abilities of a singer were underestimated.

I feel sadness from the fact that I was not born with a better  
appearance.

I was disgusted with the hypocrisy of my colleagues from the  
group.
Shame I feel I am not properly dressed.

A sense of guilt I felt once I couldn't defend the  
confidence my teacher had in me and thus discrediting him at a  
concert.
I have a new born child.
I could have been killed by a falling object.

At a certain situation I felt myself neglected and undeservedly  
harmed.
The sudden death of one of my parents.

Getting separated from my family for a week caused me a sense of  
sadness.

I felt it I saw a colleague of mine eating like a beast. At  
the same time he was making gestures, speaking and making the  
hell of a noise.

I felt a sense of shame I compromised a colleague of mine. I  
got an information from him which I quite out of place shared  
with another colleague of mine and it resulted in an unpleasant  
consequence for him.

I promised to fulfill an errand. Later I understood it was  
impracticable. The explanation I gave was accompanied by a sense  
of guilt.

I felt neutral most strongly some years ago, I took part in a  
NH Competition and I was the first.

I feel fear I only imagine I could lose confidence in my own  
abilities and powers. A similar feeling I feel sometimes before  
an exam.

I feel anger I see a "parent" beating and punishing his child  
in the street. Recently I was a withness of a similar case.

I feel sadness I only imagine that I could lose a close  
person. Some time ago I lost a man whom aI greatly respected.

A similar feeling I felt quite recently while travelling in a  
taxi. The driver treated me roughly and dishonestly - he chose  
the longest route, he overdrawed almost one lev more and he tried  
to be intimate with me.

Some days ago I fell down at a public place, I came into notice  
but thank God I was not mocked at. Though it hurt badly, at the  
first moment I felt shame, not ache.

I felt guilty because of the pain I caused to a very close  
friend. But over the feeling of guilt, my conviction of being  
right dominated.
my nephew was born. The birth was hard, it was a big baby.

Late one night I was pursued by gipsies who had no good  
intentions.

I found a big black beetle in my coffee cup. It was alive big and  
it was moving its limbs.

I had to prepare and read a paper to my fellow students but  
I didn't cope with the task.

I had thrown with the ashtray a still lighted cigarette in the  
plastic wastepaper basket. It had burnt out and my landlords made  
me a row that I might had set their flat on fire.

Some time ago I was present at the wedding party of two close  
friends of mine.

I was crossing the street together with some colleagues of mine  
I suddenly found myself almost under the wheels of a truck.

Someone stole my ski at Vitosha and of course I was the one to be  
blamed. I left them without supervision.
I got separated form my closest friend. He went to work abroad.

A drunk man had fallen in the street and he was shouting obscene  
words.
I had borrowed some money and I exceeded the time-limit.
I couldn't fulfill a promise.

An encounter with a man whom I love, after a very long  
separation.

I woke up in the middle of the night of a nightmare, I was alone,  
it was very quiet and very dark.

A shop-assistant behaved rather roughly with me though she hadn't  
the slightest grounds for it.

I saw a friend of mine who had suffered a very heavy contusion  
after an accident.
I caught a glimpse of a black-beetle.
I was made a very sharp remark at a rehearsal.
At a success of mine, at a real achievement.

I was looking after a dying patient at work one night, a young  
woman, my colleague was talking to her relatives and .... to  
offer them any support emotionally, physically and then sent them  
down to the coffee shop to have a dinner rather than offering the  
facilities available for their use cause it involved her having  
to do some work. Seeing them again I felt disgusted at her  
attitude.

I put on a lot of weight in a few months and every time I met  
someone I knew would avoid them, usually by hiding because my  
self image was low and I was ashamed of what I had done to  
myself.

I was involved in a ... attempt on a man I had developed a close  
warming relationship with. Although I knew I had done everything  
I could and that his progress of a "normal" life was poor I felt  
guilty as if I could have done more.
For the first time in my life telling someone I loved them.

I was ringing up a guy who was my teen idol, and was in  
Auckland. I was really scared, I didn't know what to say or do.

my mother decided to clean out my room and throw out what  
she thought was junk, without my knowing about it, so I returned  
home to find half my stuff gone.
I couldn't find my dog which was missing.

I was disgusted with a friend's behaviour she got absolutely  
drunk so that she vomitted all over my house.

I felt guilty after getting really angry with a friend and having  
an argument. I was being stubborn and proud, and selfish, because  
my friend let me down, through no fault of her own.

I had called a boy who had dated me, and told him that I was ill,  
while, actually, I didn't want to go out with him, later on, he asked  
me if I was feeling better, then I felt ashamed.
I hurt my parents in one way or another.
I passed the driving test after three failures.
I nearly caused a traffic accident with my car.

playing a football match, there was one player who made mean  
tackels, kicked at everything and did things having nothing to do  
with football.

A close friend decided to stop with his study and to go back  
home.

During a family reunion, they started talking about me wearing an  
ear-ring.
For instance a girl is interested in me and likes me.

Walking at friday night through Nijmegen, going to a pub or a  
disco.

I felt dusgust with a self-iterested person who ruined the life  
of another by means of utterly unfair methods.

I didn't do an important job and it had an adverse effect on  
other people.
I stroke a person undeservedly.

I sensed this feeling I passed successfully the second tour  
of a competition.
I felt fear my mother was heavily ill.

I felt anger against a colleague of mine during a rehearsal in  
acting. He hadn't learnt the text of an opera act in the course of  
several months and thus making difficulties for the rest of my  
colleagues.

I felt sadness I had to get separated from the woman I loved  
who had to leave for her motherland.

I felt disgust with the alcohol, after I happened to see a young  
man, who was dead to the world and who wallowed on the pavement.  
This "sight" I watched from the bus.

I felt shame and I couldn't look into my teacher's eyes, after  
not attending his lectures.

I was happy at difficult times I could find support in my  
friend and my fiancT, I was happy because of their spiritual and  
moral help which gave me new power to struggle. I was happy then,  
I felt it in my soul.
I felt it at the same time I felt disgust.

I felt it on the same occasion I felt sadness which finally  
grew into anger.

My living and working conditions at home were unbearable. We used  
to live in a three room flat together with two more families. The  
discords caused a change - one of the families moved out. The  
other family stayed with us but I drifted away from my fiancT. In  
fact we were two families in the flat. Then I found myself alone  
in the struggle for this life because my fiancT did not stay next  
to me my grief and sorrow took on large proportions. I wanted to  
commit suicide but instead I threw myself against the cause of  
the irritation.

I am disgusted with my sister's husband. On an early Sunday  
morning after having knocked at my door, he suddenly rushed in  
and finching me still in bed he began quarrelling about  
something. I could not understand. I heard his last words: "Don't  
stare at me so because I'll beat you in your bed" I got up  
terrified and a thrashing followed.

I feel shame mixed with anger with the behavior of some  
incultivated people because my fiancT is a foreigner.

I felt guilt because on account of my ambitions I nearly turned  
my sister out of my parents home.

That was what I felt I was finally accepted in the Bulgarian  
Conservatorie after I had applied a couple of years.

I experienced this feeling the doctors found a nodule in one  
of my mother's breasts. It turned out to be an occlusion  
resulting from continious sucking but for a few days I was not in my  
reason.

I had an accident with a trafic police car that was packed at a  
curve without any visibility and against all traffic regulations  
in a strong snowstorm. As a result I still cannot repair my car  
because of the missing spare parts.

A sudden doubt made me run for a long time in a rainy autumn  
night. I reached the intended place I saw my beloved in  
another man's arms. A sudden blow, grief, I cannot qualify it, it  
is painful for me to remember about it.

I felt disgust with a man I had trusted and respected, to whose  
problems I had always shown deep understanding.

I was given the task to learn a page of music text for a small  
part. But I had forgotten all about it and I felt quite awkward  
I had to show what I had prepared.

Some time ago I slapped my son without trying to understand who  
the real culprit of a damage was. After that I felt guilty and  
bad but it was too late.

I was to be given an audition to get a role. I had a competitress  
and I wasn't well prepared because I was ill.

I am disgusted with the fact that bad singers play at the opera  
(and not only there) only because they are protegTs or lovers of  
an important felow while at the same time some young and able  
singers work in a quite different field of life.

I feel shy to show all my worth I work for the first time  
with a conductor or a producer unfamiliar to me.
I offended my mother.

Once I was alone at home. I suddenly felt unwell and there was no  
one to help me and call First Aid.

I was admitted to a Language school. On the day I was  
informed by a message and my parents congratulated me.

diving deep into the sea to reach the floor I felt  
breathless. I was cautious but I doubted I should be able to come  
to the surface and inhale.

my friend (girl) promised to help me go to the hospital and be  
examined by good experts and she deceived me.

I had stayed abroad for a long time and I had remembered  
about my friends and relatives. I felt sad and I wanted to see  
them as soon as possible.

I felt it I saw our headmaster blushed ingratiating himself  
with high ranking officials.

I hadn't learnt my lesson and I asked the teacher to give me  
"a three" and he agreed but even he felt quite awkward.
NB: In Bulgarian schools "a three" is the second worst mark.

I shouted and quarrelled and for no reason I had been rude to my  
mother and my behaviour had been influenced by other outward  
factors.

you are satisfied with something, you achieve something  
you have striven to.

you are unjustly assessed at something you are sure to have  
been right.

For the loss of a close friend or relative, but you feel grief  
you are away from home, too.
They wanted something to happen but I didn't.
I couldn't be with a girl on whom I was very keen.

I and my friends got acquainted with a guy from Sofia who turned  
out to be gay, but we found that out only after 2 or 3 days.
Years ago I ran away from home which disappointed my parents.
Having passed an exam.
Having a car accident.

I shared a secret with a friend and it later turned out that he  
had revealed it to another person with whom I didn't get along very well.
The loss of a very good friend.
Negative statement concerning me of a friend before strangers.

I'm glad I have good relations with my colleagues and most  
of all we are at a party.

I experienced it once we were on a drive. Our car passed by  
the one comming from the opposite direction at an incredibly  
small distance.

I get angry with people who attain certain status without  
deserving it, only with the support, authority and influence of  
other people.

I feel sad I see things done against men and nothing could  
stop it - at least I think so.

I have experienced disgust with some people - usually double  
dealers.

I am ashamed I am not prepared in a subject and I have to  
answer in the presence of the patients.

I feel guilty I should have done something at any rate but I  
haven't done it.

I experienced it I was accepted at the Medical Higher  
Institute.
I felt it I sat for my exam in anatomy.

I experience that feeling I am unsulted without deserving  
it or someone deceives me.
my grandfather died.
I feel disgusted with toadies, hypocrites, chameleons.
I do something unworthy.
I offended my parents without wanting it.
After each successfully passed exam I am happy.

A friend of mine gave birth to a child. Very dangerous delivery.  
I was afraid for her and for the baby.

I get angry someone imputes on me things I never can do,  
naturally negative. Servility, "connections", impudence, traits  
that get me mad.
I am disgusted with liers, hypocrites, slanderers, flunkeys.

Recently I saw a young girl fawning on a man. And what for -  
money and things. I was ashamed to be a woman.
I have been overhastingly offending or hurting.

Few years ago my father was very ill. He stayed at a hospital for  
a long time. Then I experienced that terrible feeling that I  
might lose him.

I have a friend that I deeply trusted but it happened that I lost  
my confidence in her for which she herself was to blame.

We are several friends but our characters are very different and  
we inevitably split in the two extremes. It is sad that I myself  
don't know what to do, I try not to hurt either of the "parties"  
because there are conflicts to which one I should belong.

I stayed for several weeks with a friend of mine before she moved  
to live with her husband. One evening he came drunk and made an  
awful scene, which I still remember.

In the past I experienced this feeling almost all the time -  
wherever I went, in different sutuations. I was small and I had  
to be taken to kindergarten, but me the fool didn't dare to tell  
exactly where, finally as a result I was late.

My roommate got married and invited me to share a flat with them.  
But with a young couple there should not be a third person. I am  
to blame for not following the advise of the others, but it is  
not late still.

I experienced this feeling I was accepted as a student.  
Because everything turned out different from my expectations.  
Although I passed the exam successfully I was accepted as a  
student only I didn't expect it at all, namely at the  
beginning of September.

In the real sense of the word I experienced fear in my first  
months in the army. During my first night of duty. The cause for  
all this was a bear. I became panic sticken (may be for the first  
time) and even forgot that I had a gun.

I was a soldier I quarrelled with my commander and may be in  
revenge for this he detailed me on duty two successive nights.  
Naturally he checked me up on the second night and found me  
asleep for which he sent me to the cells.

Sort of awkward. I'd introduced (a lover) but introduced as a  
friend to some members of my family, and my niece Yavanna who's  
six was home from school and at Mum's and Dad's and was really  
silly and at first it was ok, but it went on and on - yukky pooh!  
You eat your snot, etc. and I felt cross she wouldn't stop. But  
she had an audience and was in one of those moods. Once I'd  
accepted it was something everyone does at time I felt better -  
it was partly having my friend there.

I used to pinch change from my father's mantlepiece (never my  
mother - she didn't get enough housekeeping) and then I'd feel  
we went to church as a family I'd felt awkward cos I felt  
I'm expected to go to communion and I would but I was afraid and  
guilty 'cos I committed a mortal sin.
Spontaneous picnic with sister and friend and children - great.
Can think of no time that I have felt fear.

Teenage neighbours smashed my letterbox for the fifth time in a  
couple of months. It was a deliberate action of kids who had  
stayed in my home, had meals there yet took a dislike to my  
daughter.
Guy I cared for went back to Canada to live.

Bus driver driving roughly - old man fell off seat into aisle -  
driver wouldn't stop - disgusted with her behaviour.

A daughter in court for staff pilfering, she was dressed like a  
"street walker" - I had a friend form overseas with me and was  
falsely trying to impress with my family.

Reported neighbour to police for taking to my daughter with  
baseball ball - her counsellor rang me and after long talk  
convinced me the woman was o.k. I felt guilty for ringing the  
police then guilty for feeling guilty about it.

Meeting with two of my friends I had not seen for 15 years. They  
were special people to me.

I was in the Korean War. We were attacked with mortars, me and  
companion. We stopped the jeep and ran for cover. Fortunately  
neither of us was hit but we both came close to being killed.

I've a situation of responsibility an employee who had a habit of  
being late, came late again after promising to say he would be at  
work in a few minutes, then arrived 3 hours later. He had been  
drinking.
Disgust at myself I stroked a sleeping girl's private parts.

My son was apprehended for shoplifting at the age of 14. Because  
I too had been apprehended at the same age I felt the shame of  
not having been able to prevent my son from acting in the same  
way.

I removed an article of clothing belonging to my employer while  
in a position of trust.

we took out an 84 year old woman for the evening and had  
hamburgers. She described the evening out as her happiest night  
out in 20 years.

While tramping on a narrow path two of us were confronted by a  
woman with two snarling dogs, demanding we get off the property -  
via a flooded river !

A friend got angry and drove "like a lunatic" with me and others  
in his car. I was angry about his dangerous driving.

A boy I look after for the probation service deliberately  
offended to provoke a reaction from the police.

4-letter words on a TV programme (Roche) while we were  
entertaining "conservative" relations who wanted to see the first  
episode.

A young visitor to the house stole money from an elderly  
visitor's purse. It wasn't noticed for some hours.

I had to leave an important function early because of family  
commitments. Someone else had to complete my job.

I was seriously injured in a road accident. The very first steps  
I took with only one crutch to support me I felt so good. I enneutral  
being alive.

I was attacked, standing in a doorway, by a pack of 5 dogs,  
alsatians and farm dogs with my escape route blocked by a shut  
fence.

In the house where I live there is a new flatmate. His friends  
unfortunately are the dirt of society, intelligent, fashonable,  
rich and bored. At a party recently they were doing things I  
didn't like done in my house. I felt angry at them.

I was young I stole something from a shop and got caught,  
then I was taken to the police station and my parents had to come  
and get me.

I found out that a set task (i.e. 2 essays and a test), the  
thought of which had oppressed me, were not on the date I had  
thought.
confronted and in my opinion hassled by the police.

Disgust - no. Maybe it is more precise to say revultion at a worm  
or a snake. But I mean it in a social aspect somebody had  
behaved like a scoundrel to you, by his actions he has made  
you change your attitude towards him but I thing this feeling the  
way I meant it, is not typical for the people interrelations.

I have forgotten to warn somebody for something, or I  
have forgotten to bring something I have been asked for.

When, for example, my grandfather fell seriously ill. It was  
necessary for him to be operated and I felt great fear of losing  
him because he is so dear to me.

When, for example, I left for the first time my parents and I  
went to live in Sofia.
When, for example, someone is calumnating.
When, for example, I fail in my undertakings.

For example, I have promised something but I haven't  
fulfilled it.

Some time ago a close relative of mine got off cheap with the  
worst.
The last time I felt it was I was coming home late at night.
I haven't often felt this feeling. Once someone stole my garment.
Recently I happened to remain alone for a long time.

I don't remember about a situation I have experienced this  
feeling. Maybe it was I saw a drunkard in the street.
I lied to my best friend and I wouldn't reform what I had done.
It happens to me quite often. I can't describe a particular case.

Realizing one's desire, an experienced feeling of satisfaction  
from the realization of one's desires and aims.

Fear of the loss of a close friend, of feeling the ground slipping  
from under my feet.

Attitude to some manners of dealing and some "sanctioned"  
relations.

Feeling unable to preserve one's ideas and ambitions as innocent  
as they are you are young.
Attitude to a related family.

Exaggerating certain circumstances, wrong attitude and evaluation  
of these circumstances.
Low evaluation of other people's cares.
If a close relative's life is in danger.
A close person lied to me.
Encouter with a prostitute.
A theft committed by me.
Lack of respect for my parents.
my son was born.
Unjust punishment of a friend of mine.
After the loss of a close relative.

somebody behaves like a scoundrel. Recently a colleague of  
mine used the name of another one for his own benefit.

I travelled on a bus and I forgot to punch the ticket. A ticket  
collector came in and I had to pay the fine. I did it with a feeling  
of shame.
I forgot to convey an important announcement.
Meeting a loved man.

I felt a physical fear, if I can call it this way, today, in the bus where  
I was sitting on the first seat. While turning the driver didn't  
see the tram which was making a dash towards us (coming from the  
side I was), and whose driver intended to cross in yellow  
light.

At an unjust, or to be more precise, at a bureaucratic treatment  
of one's personality.
one is alone and knows that all the others are celebrating.
At the sight of an insect, such as the black-beetle.

not fulfilling any of my obligations to a person whom I  
respect.

something unpleasant happens to a friend or relative of  
yours and you are at the bottom of it.

This feeling I sensed quite recently. It was arisen by the  
terrific thought that I might lose the man I loved !

Sometimes, I'm alone I am seized by this feeling. But it  
always helps me to come round and at the same time to judge if it  
is worth. Very often this feeling is caused to me by people -  
friends who I love and respect.

Such a feeling springs up in me sometimes I have meals at a  
catering establishment. It is a result either of the look of the  
food or watching the way some people eat.
This happens to me I am not prepared in a given subject.

I had to have my tonsils out. I had been making up my mind almost  
for a year - I was afraid. But during the two hours in the  
hospital room, while I was waiting to be called for the operation I  
felt a real fear - of the pain, of what they were going to do to  
me, of the unknown.

Summer, heavy rain, storm - I was standing with my face stick to  
the window: the childhood, something was going away forever this  
summer, I was leaving my home, I was going to study in another  
town, for the first time I was leaving my parents, friends, I had  
to manage myself, a long and loved period of my life was over - I  
was crying.
I saw in the street a man spitting.

I talked with a man who stammered and without controlling myself,  
I started to talk imitating him.
Always, and this happens often I do not keep my word.

I felt this feeling one day my landlord's cat had crept  
under my bed and I couldn't cope with it during an hour and a  
half.

I feel this feeling I am to fill in a questionnaire or a  
form.
the man I loved decided to leave me forever.

I have felt this feeling a person whom I believe and respect,  
lied to me.

I feel shame sometimes, (unconsciously) I behave unethically  
and without understanding the problems of the man I love.
I offend somebody unfairly.

A quarrel was followed by the decision of leaving a person close  
to me. Several days later my regret was great. I was beside  
myself. Quite unexpectedly he came and the conflict was calmly  
solved. I was glad at the possibility to be with him.

One evening I was watching the news on TV. Again they were  
talking about the danger of war. Suddenly I imagined what it  
might mean for me, for my friends, for the people close to me. I  
felt it a very near and possible event.

Unfair and unjust attitude toward a person close to me, what I  
was the witness of, caused anger in me.

The thought that I'll never sit at the school desk again, caused  
a deep grief at the end of my eleventh form.

I felt disgust with a person whose behaviour was out of the  
elementary human norms.

I had not punched a ticket in the bus because I had a card. But  
the ticket-collector came it turned out that I had forgotten  
it. The shame I felt was great though it was not done on purpose.

At a moment of affect I offended a person very close to me. He  
had given me ground for that but it was a trifling in comparison  
with the way I insulted him. A moment later I felt a sense of  
guilt.

I broke my knee I was skiing over "Yastrebetz" (a racing  
track in a Bulgarian winter resort).

My son lives with my parents in the country and I feel this  
feeling always leaving for Sofia, but the last time it was  
quite strong.

A colleague of mine asked a lecturer to put him a higher mark in  
order to keep his good mards and thus to continue getting a  
scholarship for an excellent grade.
I felt this feeling during the exam in higher mathematics.

My son drank four pills of diazepam every two hours instead of  
amidophen.

I felt fear once, the car in which I travelled directed  
towards the precipice along the road.

I see how people around me pass by certain unjustice because  
of indifference or cowardice.
I left a man in whom I really believed.
Disgust with drunk people.
I try to lie.

I had had the possibility to act or to do certain activity  
better but I had not done it because of reluctance or  
carelessness.
I broke my leg I felt fear.
someone lies to me.
At an unjust insult or injure.

From the cigarette smoke. Usually I feel disgust from it I  
am in a restaurant.
I promise to do something but I don't fulfill it.
I don't fulfill my obligations.
my affairs with the girl I love settled positively.

In a dam lake, the water was let flow to water the plants  
and I and two other boys were near the water pit. We rescued  
ourselves only thanks to the flippers and the tyre that was with  
us.

It was quite recently, at the football match between the national  
teams of Bulgaria and France. I felt strong anger with the Scottish  
referee who ran the match quite partially.

I am alone and listen to a song which I like very much and  
which I had listened before together with friends.
A striking act of ingratitude at a public vehicle.

I counterfeited a mark in the school register during the lesson  
in gymnastics. I felt this feeling two days later I stood  
face to face with my teacher, whom I highly appreciated and  
respected.

In a fit of temper I told things that were unjust and they  
greatly hurt my mother though she didn't show it.

I passed successfully the preliminary exam for a participation in  
the children Assembly.

I was alone in my room at the boarding house at 12 o'clock  
someone knocked violently on the door.

A friend of mine promised to come with me to the cinema but he  
didn't come.

I had to prepare a report but I couldn't write it. I read from a  
book off-hand, I was quite uneasy and I felt I didn't manage.

My father got a slight heart attack after a telephone call of  
mine.
Bulgaria won a football match against France.
I was going to knock down a pedestrian with my car.
I was neglected undeservedly.
I didn't offer my seat to a pregnant woman in the bus.
I didn't attend lectures.
I felt neutral my two twin sisters were born.

The night before my wife had given birth to our twins. I felt  
fear in the hospital yard, I feared if everything was going to be  
in order.

About a month ago the Regional Council refused to pay my wife the  
due maternity benefit, because of bureaucratic reasons.

Some months ago my wife gave birth to twin sisters. She had no  
idea of looking after babies and she felt quite oppressed. The  
fact that I couldn't help her caused grief to me.

I feel disgust with some people I see what they are capable  
of, including lack of any dignity, trying to find a seat in  
the tram.
