This morning during my sleep I had a feeling that someboby was  
attacking me.  I started crying in my sleep and then my room-mate  
woke me up.
I learnt that my cousin sister was pregnant.

My cousin and I were at the farm and at night we drunk like fools  
and made a lot of noise.  We had drunk two much of wine.

The fridge we had at home had a lock.  One day I wanted  
something, I unscrewed the door but unfortunately I was caught in  
the act.

I saw an accident, a woman was run over and she died on the  
spot.

my dress and a few other things were stolen from my  
wardrobe.

While watching a movie, someone who was drunk started vomiting  
helplessly.

I ate my sister's food and then she found out that it was  
me.  I felt very ashamed but still refused to admit that it was  
me.

I told a person something that had happened to my friend,  
and this person went and told my friend.
I was told that the form five results were out.

I saw my younger sister being bothered by a boy she did not  
know.

The time I lost a badminton match, that I should have won at the  
Zambia closed badminton championships.
I beat up a stupid boy who was fond of cracking jokes on me.
I was selected for higher education, i.e grade 7 to formI.

I impregnated a certain girl, I thought that I would be  
forced to marry her or go to court.

my mother and father separated (it was a brief separation  
and they are together now).

I patronized a certain tavern which had prostitutes, it was  
almost a brothel.
I proposed love to a girl and she turned me down.

I sided with my mother in a quarrel she had with my father  
before they briefly separated.

I received a letter from a woman I thought had not ever  
cared for me.  This was I needed her and I was overneutraled to  
learn that it was me who was delaying things.

Two guys were fighting murderously and I feared that one of them  
would be killed.
I could not reason my friend, it angered me.

I did not like it a little girl was crying for her dead  
mother and was calling her by her name.  I was sad.

I feel disgusted at not having got aa "A" in yesterday's  
practicals of G220.
I felt very ashamed at having got a book by force from a girl.

I felt guilty of having suspected my room-mate of stealing the  
money last term.

Our only elder sister got married and started having pains in her  
abdomen and she was told that she could not have children. To our  
suprise she had a baby 2 months back.

My uncle was taken to the UTC for an operation as he had cancer.   
There had been a lot of deaths of late - 3 out of every 4  
operated.  I was scared for my uncle's life.

I had planned to go to town with my friend at 1500 hours but she  
went for the registration and I waited for a good 1 and a 1/2 hours.  It  
was vital for me to go to town but I could not as it was she who  
had the money.  Finally I borrowed some money from friends and we  
went to town.  I was really angry with my friend.

I dreamt of my father's death while I was at secondary school.  I  
was screaming at the top of my voice and was woken up by my  
friend.  That day I was really sad.

I was very happy my scholarship to continue studying at UNZA  
was approved after it had been cancelled.
I met an elephant in the bush.
someone took my pen away.

my cousin passed away during the holidays at home.  He fell  
ill at night and the next day he died in the evening.

An officer at the Dean of students office had promised me to give  
me a room the next day, but he failed to keep his promise.

I do not have accomodation on the campus so I stay with my  
extended family, one young man used bad words while asking me to  
leave their home.
I broke a glass of glycerine at the Z.C.B.C store in Ndola.
I was with someone I love.
I was walking around all alone at night.
Being made to look like a fool by a girl.
my dad passed away.
I was told that I had no right to control my lover.
Getting very low marks in mathematics.
one of my lovers told me that I was a flirt.
At my sister's wedding.
I had to walk along a dark road alone.
I was locked out of my room by my room-mate's friend.
I found out that someone close to me was flirting around.
I swindled money out of someone.
I did not deliver a message on time.

the lady who is now my wife accepted my proposal to be my  
lover and future wife.

my neighbour's house was broken into and shots could be  
heard.
a thief broke into my house and stole some valuable goods.

The death of my guardian with whom I had stayed I did my  
grade six.

I was substituted in a play which was to be staged, after I  
had learnt all the lines.

a woman who I respected very much was made pregnant,  
unexpectedly by a man of a caliber I never expected.

I applied for a false travelling claim allowance and later I  
thought that I would be found out.

I felt happy my mother gave birth to a son who is the last  
born in the family.

My father had been involved in a car accident two years ago.  I  
was then very scared thinking that he would die as he lay  
unconscious in hospital for two weeks.

I felt very sad a friend of mine failed the final exam and  
she could not be accepted at the institution of learning.

I felt disgusted a fellow student asked me to marry him.  I  
had not expected this from him as he was a mere friend.

I was ashamed my friend and I were cross with each other  
till we apologized to each other.

I felt guilty I said bad things to my sister, I had not  
intended to do so.  She cried a lot and later she fell ill and I  
felt responsible for her illness.
I was selected to study here at UNZA.

In 1960,  I was going to a school which was near my village and I  
met a lion on the way, which disappeared suddenly.
my wife told me that the refrigerator had stopped working.
I heard of the death of my mother.
I failed one of the first year's courses.

I was overwhelmed with neutral I received the acceptance letter  
to UNZA.  This happened again I passed all my first year  
courses.

In 1977 my friend was caught by a crocodile.  We were  
swimming in a river on whose banks our primary school was  
situated.  my friend was caught, he was on the banks of the  
river and some of us were still in the middle of the river.  I  
was very frightened.

In 1982, I was annoyed at an uncle who was drunk and was beating  
up his old father.  He claimed that the father was responsible  
for his guardian's failure.

Last academic year I received bad news - my grand-uncle had  
passed away.  I felt lonely and bad because apart from the          
biological ties, he was a good old friend of mine at home.

Last week a former school (secondary) mate of mine, who is now in  
a differentt school came to my room here at UNZA in my absence.   
He was drunk and he vomited in my room.  I was unhappy.

A few years back I had proposed love to a girl who later turned out  
to be related to me.  Though we were in love with each other, we  
both felt ashamed and withdrew from each other.

Last year I was asked to look after my niece while her mother was  
cooking.  Unfortunately the kid fell off the bed, I was confident  
that she would not fall and had not been paying much attention.

I qualified for form I.  I was one of the three pupils who  
qualified for form I that year.

I learnt that the girl I had impregnated was in hospital and  
was on the verge of dying as she had refused to accept the  
responsibility of her pregnancy and had wanted to commit suicide.

I got home I found that the electrical supply had been  
disconnected despite my having paid ZESCO the full bill a few   
days earlier.

my demand for accomodation on the campus was refused and the  
rooms were allotted to first year students who were from "Rucher"  
and came from influential families.

I told the driver at my workplace to lie and tell the boss  
that it was not me who was responsible for the delay.  The boss  
was very annoyed and the driver was punished and a day's salary  
was taken away from him.
my wife gave birth to a baby boy - my only son to date.

burglars with guns forced themselves into my house and  
ordered me to give them money or face death.
my colleague spat on my face after a quarrel.
my friend, after a beer spree vomitted in my sitting room.

I was taken to the place where my uncle had defecated in his  
pants after having drunk beer.

it was discovered that I had done the assignment at my work  
place, this caused a lot of embarrassment for me.
Whhen the front tyre of the car burst.
I was insulted by a fellow student.
the girl I loved turned me down.
I found my girl in bed with another man.
I failed grade 7.

I passed the first year and so I could come back for my  
second year.

I was working at a certain place and everyday after work dad  
would come to pick me up.  One day he did not come, it started  
getting very dark and I had no money on me and my home was very,  
very far away.

I realized that I was pregnant.  I thought about what my  
relatives and friends would think about me and I felt a lot of  
self pity.

One day I was working, I went out for dinner with friends  
without my parents knowledge and I only came home at 2300 hours.

Last night, I dreamt that things that looked like monsters were  
trying to kiss me.

One of my colleagues accused me of having stolen his iron and I  
was sure that I had done no such thing.
The passing away of my mum.

One of these people who sell meat in town used a knife to stab  
his friend and later carried on using the same knife to cut meat.

About a dozen girls laughed at me and I was sure that there was  
nothing wrong with me.

This is a kind of confession - my mum found me stealing meat from  
the pot.
The first time I really fell in love with a girl.

The time I drove my uncle's car, without having asked for his  
permission.  It was the first time that I was driving a car.
I, for the first time, failed a junior exam, i.e form 3.
my mum learnt that I had beaten up someone in a fight.
I nearly got my fiancee pregnant.

my sister's first child came home, after one week in  
intensive care at the hospital.

I was at a boarding school at Lusaka, the Rhodesian  
soldiers came to bomb a house near our school and we saw the  
whole scene.

A very close friend of mine was refused entrance to the medical  
school.  Her grades were very good and she should not have been  
left out.  Biased judgment !

My sister lost one of her twin sons (my first nephews) and then  
the older one died a week later.

I went to report a stolen good at the police station, the  
woman-officer-in-charge was very rude and did not seem to have  
respect for anyone.

I insulted two of my friends because I thought that had been  
gossiping about me right under my nose, however I later found out  
that they were not doing so.

I failed to keep a promise and this had a serious effet on someone's  
problem.
I met my mother after not having seen her for three years.

my neighbour's life was threatened by someone who was trying  
to break into his house.

I went to the library three weeks after it had opened and  
found that everyone was busy.
my friend was punished for something that I had done.

For my parents anniversary, we hosted a party and we were very  
happy.

Some people were sitting outside and saying things which were not  
really true.
A break-up with someone I really liked.

I came across a woman in town who was very drunk.  She was  
swearing at everyone and carried on drinking even though she  
could hardly stand.
I was wearing a slit tight dress at a disco and it burst open.

I had stopped talking to a very close friend of mine.  A week  
later he came over to try and make friends with me  again and  
from the way he talked I felt that he was a very mean preson.
I accepted Jesus Christ as my personal saviour.

I witnessed a bus accident in which a bus, full of passengers,  
 nearly overturned on the Lusaka-Kabwe road.

my sister came home late one day and thus disobeyed my  
parents.
I heard the news of my grandfather's sudden death.
my younger sister, who was then 16 years old, was pregnant.
I hurt my sisters for no reason at all.

I got a very nasty electrical shock I was tampering with  
some electrical applainces.
I was subjected to a very nasty joke by a group of friends.

I received my results and found out that I could not go to a  
school of my choice.

I found a maggot in my food at the dinning hall, all the  
food had gone bad.

I took a girl out once and discovered that she was going around  
with one of my close friends.

An item which belonged to a friend of mine was missing.  I had  
taken it earlier and I thought that I had returnrd it so he  
asked me for it I stubbornly refused having it.  Later I  
looked for it, I found it in my room.
I got my results ( I had made it to the second year ).
my grandfather died.

I heard that my sister had shouted at my friend's cousin at  
their place.
I failed the grade 7.

I had lied, saying that I never take bread from the dinning  
hall and a friend of mine caught me doing it.  He thus proved to  
me that I did in fact take the bread.

my girl told me that she loved me more than any male  
creature on earth and that I would be the only one in her heart  
for all her life.

The day I was nearly stabbed to death by ruffians who wanted to  
take my money.  I refused to give them any money and they started  
running after me, I ran into somebody else's house to save  
myself.

a kid dropped my father's radio cassette player, which he  
had just repaired.

someone I love told me that she did not love me anymore and  
that she wanted all the snaps that she had given me in exchange  
for the ones I had given her.

a girl said in my back that we were in love, and she had  
actually refused me.  I confronted her she started insulting  
me.

I told a lie to a friend of my sister on April fool's day.   
She later came to see me and told me that it was a very foolish  
thing to do.

A girl dropped some stuff from her bag and I tried to help  
her I realized that she had used me and I was made to look like a  
fool.
I learnt that I had been accepted at UNZA.

thieves broke into my house at night and held my wife and me  
on gun-point for at least ten minutes and took away a lot of  
property.

I was beaten up by thieves on behalf of some friends of mine  
as they thought that I had a lot of money and would not part  
with a few coins for their drinks.

I received the news that my in-laws had passed away.  I  
depended heavily on them for their guidance and the running of  
their daughter's buisness.

my younger sister visited me during the school holidays and  
told me that she would not go back to school because she was  
pregnant.

I cheated my father and told him that the school  
administration wanted K80 for the purchase of a mini-bus.  Two  
months later the school authorities wrote back to my father for  
the money.  I could not go back and ask him for the money again  
as he had already given it to me once.

I received the acceptance letter from UNZA.  I had just  
come home from work my kind sister handed me an enveloppe  
which I opened and was overcome with neutral.

I was at home and we were sleeping we heard some robbers  
breaking into our house.

A certain boy came into my room and started telling me that I was  
not pretty, that I had no manners and that I should learn some.   
I had just come to campus and he was in fourth year.

My elder sister whom I love very much was leaving for the           
West Indies for two years and I was staying behind.

A certain girl asked me what my major was and I told her  
that it was P.A she started criticizing it saying, "I hate that  
course."  She just shows off in front of other people.
I took an exam which I failed terribly as I had not studied.

I was drunk one night and I insulted three ladies.  The following  
morning they approached me and asked me the reason behind my  
bahaviour, I apologized for my unruly behaviour.

I felt happy I learnt that I had qualified for the grade  
eight.

I was afraid I learnt that my father was seriously ill in  
hospital.

I found out that the seat in the coach that I had booked had  
been sold to somebody else.
money was stolen from my pocket.

I discovered that the girl I was courting was a relative of  
mine.
My son passed grade 7 and was accepted for form I.
the robbers broke in, at night.

I wrote an assignment and was given less marks than a friend with  
whom I had previously discussed the assignment.
I got a message that my child was not feeling well.

I bought something and the shopkeeper gave me more change, I  
realized this after I had left the shop and was on the bus-stop -  
and I then needed the money.

The day my parents were involved in a car accident and had to be  
operated  and before the operation the doctor said that it was  
mater of life or death.

I got into an argument with a photographer for whom I had to pose  
twelve times, over  a period of four weeks, before I could get a  
snap of mine.  Every time the film was processed my snap did not  
come out although the others did.

I was sad at the expulsion of some of my comrades during the UNZA  
demonstrations.

I was disgusted at the way the bus conductor threw out an old  
woman oiut of the mini-bus simply because she could not pay the  
fare for her luggage.

I had a feeling of shame I found myself unable to answer  
some questions from my tutor simply because of a lack of  
preparation.

This last August my parents dropped me off and moved me into  
college I didn't know anybody here; I was 17 and Berkeley really  
scared me.

The same as for SHAME and DISGUST. I was asked to resign my  
sorority which I did because I was ashamed.
The same as in SHAME.

On a road trip with a group of sorority and fraternity people, I  
became intoxicated and basically raped. I don't remember the  
actual event, but I know the feeling that I experienced later.

I got fired from a job because I gave a discount to a  
friend.
Our basketball team is undefeated in league play (4-0) currently.

I saw in a movie a block on which affluence and poverty existed.  
I saw that the rich made no attempts to help the poor.

I felt powerless to help the poor or I don't know how  
to.

I felt disgusted at my teams poor perfomance prior to league  
play.

I was walking home from a place on southside and I live on  
Northside and I was followed. I headed my most direct route.

Someone signed up for a workshift at the co-op where I live and  
she did not want to work the switchboard. I became very angry.  
She had mentioned earlier that she wanted and needed the  
workshift to me so I did not sign up.

I saw someone that I thought I knew repeatedly drunk. I do not  
like to be around alcoholics.

Every time I was around this one person I would stick my foot in  
my mouth by being nasty. One time I accidently said something  
fairly cruel that was totally inappropriate.

I blew up at someone for being confused and because of his  
irresponsibility and afterwards I felt guilty and that I had no  
right.

I was river rafting in Nev. and our boat tipped over and I was  
sucked under in to some rocks and got stuck and all I could think  
was that I was going to die. And it was so quiet under the water  
it seemed like no one would care or remember.

I was listening to a priest in church saying how sinful man was,  
and how all men should renounce their desires and pleasures to  
please God. I could never understand how something that brings you  
neutral could be a sin.

I was 5, a few of my friends and I would light matches for  
fun. One of my friends confessed to her parents and my parents, I  
guess, knew or suspected I was involved but I said I knew  
nothing about it.
I felt extreme neutral the day I was baptized. I was one with God.

I felt fear my friend and I broke into an abandoned military  
base in Los Angeles this summer. I feared because I didn't want  
to be caught.

I experienced anger most recently I had committed a sin  
which I had gone a week and a half without doing. I had made a  
vow to God and had blown it. Now I had to start all over.

I last really felt sad I left home for I was leaving all my  
long time, pre-kindergarten relationships behind.

I just took a shower with a girl down the hall. I felt that  
I had let my devotion to God go out the window. Although nothig  
happened I felt ashamed.
I committed the sin of immorality mentioned before.
Finally being asked by someone to a banquet.

A few weeks back, as I was in a hurry to leave the house, I left  
some of my things lying around.  This is something I never do. My  
uncle,who lives with us, as we live in a joint family, remarked that  
we were always doing things like  this.  This really got me mad.

A friend of mine had said something about not liking to come to  
my place just before coming to my place.   In the meanwhile I got  
to learn about this from another friend of mine and she  
arrived at my place I really treated her badly.  I was later  
ashamed of the way I had treated someone the person was at  
my place.

A few days back my mother was not feeling too well and still did  
all the house work.  I felt guilty as I had not offered to help.
I was scared of water I was a child.
I get home late my father scolds me and this makes me angry.
my aunt died.

A friend of mine remembered me she needed me and did not  
even think about me she did not need me.
I got 1 mark in an Abnormal Psychology exam.
[ I have not felt this emotion.]

I dreamt that my family was in trouble and was facing many  
difficulties.

[ family mmembers or friends blame me for something I am not  
responsible for.  I feel very sad as it was not my fault.]

[ I feel disgust at people lying.  It means that they say one  
thing to one person and the same thing in another way to another  
person and this makes people quarrel among themselves.]

my pet dog,who was to us a family member, died.  He had been  
vomitting for the past three days and we had not found the time  
to call a vet, finally the vet came it was already too late.

last year in college I received the award "Best Student of the Year",  
  I felt very happy as I got what I had wanted and my wish had  
been fulfilled.

Once I woke up in the middle of the night and felt frightened as  
everyone else was sleeping and I could not even go to their  
room.

[ It irritates me people talk about me behind my back.  I     
prefer people to tell me what they have to, on my face instead  
of talking behind my back.]
[ friends and colleagues talk bad about me.]

At work I did not get the full co-operation of my colleagues  
to complete an assignment.
[ I acted against my mind or conscious.]

In 1980 I was in the 12th standard, we had arranged a small  
picnic in Kandala.  One of my closest friends wrote a small and  
cute poem for me, which expressed the feeling of closeness we had  
for each other.  I was very thrilled and I can still remember it.

Once I was caught by thugs aged between 20-35, they asked me to  
surrender all the property I had and I remember feeling very scared.

Once my friend and I got into into a hot discussion on a very  
controversial topic.  At one point of the argument I disagreed  
with her totally and I took what she was saying as an insult.  So  
I couter-argued and unknowingly hurt her emotionally, I felt very  
sad about this.

I lost a wallet while travelling, since it belonged to the  
group I was very afraid.

a person whom I had invited did not come on the appointed  
day and time.

I tried my level best to care for my client, I took an  
appointment with a doctor and before meeting the doctor he  
expired - a poor small boy from Uttar Pradesh.

My notes were not returned to me, it kept on being  
procrastinated.
I was misbehaving in the agency.

A friend of mine got encouragement and I did not, as the  
supervisor did not like me.
I got the scholarship letter from Australia.
going to the exam.
[ I do not get any co-operation from my friends/partners.]

I had known the girl for a few months I proposed to her and this  
put an end to our friendship, as from then on we started  
withdrawing from each other.  I liked her very much.

my elder sister had a baby girl.  She was the first girl in  
the family after 19 years of baby boys.

our school was raided by the pupils of the boys secondary  
school who beat us up.

my room-mate locked up the keys of my room in our room after  
I had told her that I was  only in the bathroom having a shower.  
 She left and I had to do without supper.

One evening a boy who was drunk made a pass at me by trying  
to kiss me.

I had promised to do some washing for my mother and I did  
not do it.  She did it herself despite her being ill.  I felt  
very guilty.

I was very happy I passed and went to form I.  It was a  
great relief for me as I had been very worried considering the  
large number of pupils who fail.

During the last academic year i.e 1983/1984 just before the  
closure, we were surrounded and threatened by the paramilitary  
forces.
someone I trusted very much, disappointed me.

a close friend of mine who was with me in first year could  
not make it to the second year.
one of my friends started misbehaving.

I failed one of the tests because I had not worked hard  
enough.
I was scolded by my dad for bad behaviour.

The first day that I was close to a dead body, in my third year  
at UNZA, school of medicine.
I got to know that my father had passed away.

I was saying bad things about a man I had never seen.  I was  
with a friend and did not know that she was related to this man.   
My friend did not tell me about it and I discovered this myself.

A very, very close friend of mine used to come to my room to       
see me and I naver bothered to pay him a visit.  One day he asked  
me the reason behind this and I gave him a shirt.

I received the first year results as the first year had  
involved a lot of work and I was very pleased I got the  
results.
mother was very ill, I feared that she would die.

a boy, who was drunk, insulted me in front of a crowd.  I  
was stopped from punching him for it.

a student accused me of having stolen his textbook  as he  
had found a form bearing my name in his other books and all my  
explanations fell on deaf ears.

my mother found me in her bedroom "stealing" sugar in her  
bedroom.  According to our customs there comes a stage a  
child stops using the parents bedroom and I was well past that  
age.

The computer at school had left out my name along with four  
others and I had no rights for one year.  So I was happy to find  
my name on the medical schhol list.

We were driving on a very dusty road at night and the driver  
tried to overtake a very big truck only to find another big truck  
parked right in front.

I had gone on a vacation and my mother left home without leaving  
me any thing - money to come back to school.
I remember being sad whe my aunt's child died (2 days old).

I was eating in the dinning hall and some women joined me.  I  
could not eat with them so I left the dinning hall.

I was about to share lunch with my aunt's husband she told  
me that I would have to wait and eat with my cousins.

I had been very weary all week - no letters, no phonecalls, no  
visitors and then my younger sister came with some cheese, a card  
and some pocket money for me; and she told me that she was  
working now.

A friend gave me a lift and we met a road-block.  He tried  to  
turn back an officer shouted at us to stop.  My friend took a  
turn suddenly and the officer raised his gun but by the time we  
were gone.

I had worked very hard during my vacations to raise some money  
for a few major items (e.g a radio).  but I arrived at the  
inter-city bus terminal, my hard earned money had been stolen  
from me.

I went to the shopping centre to buy something and saw packets of  
Kapenta  with maggots in them. Oh !

I had a misunderstanding with my father and after some time I  
found that I had been wrong.

my girl and I decided to get back together after our  
separation.

I was so sick that my relatives thought that I was bewitched.  I  
felt like dying.

my girl went away for a holiday without saying good-bye to  
me.
I bought new clothes and put them on.
I went to my first dental appointment.

my father banned me from going to his sister's home due to  
some misunderstanding between the two.

my room-mate made a mess of the room after having drunk the  
whole night at a graduation party ceremony.

After I reluctantly refused to dine with a certain man on the  
same table.

I was in love with a very beautiful girl and I went back for  
my holidays I found her wth another guy who she said was just a  
friend.  Later I found them together and was convinced that there  
was something fishy.

I went to see the dead body of my uncle.  This was a very  
dramatic expreience as it was the first time that I entered a  
mortuary.

I went to spend a night with a relative of mine and there I  
found that the bed had been wet the previous night.

The first time that I "played with myself" despite being a  
Christian.  I had read in the bible that it was wrong to make  
love to someone one is not married to.

I entered the dissection room for the first time and was  
exposed to preserved dead human bodies.

I learnt that my younger sister had been expelled from  
secondary school because she was pregnant.  That was the second  
time that this happened in the family - the first time it had  
been my elder sister.
