very nervous and thought that it would cause defects in his head.

I was very angry one day my husband ignored me and slept       
on a separate bed.  He had no reasons to doubt me or to neglect  
me and I had never imagined that he could do such a thing.

I heard the news of the death of my father.  It was in the  
evening and I was alone all night in my room trying to remember  
the face of my father.

One day my colleague misbehaved with me.  I felt disgusted and  
thought to myself that he could only do this because I was a  
woman.

One day I addressed my husband in an abusive manner in front of  
his friends.  Later on I realized this myself and felt ashamed of  
myself.

My mother misunderstood me and prevented me from doing something.  
 In return I did not talk to her for a few days, only later on I  
realized that what she had done had been for my good.

I felt afraid just before receiving the question paper of the  
part II exam.

On the last day of my school life I was very sad, specially on  
the farewell party day.  I felt sad to leave behind my beloved  
teachers and friends.

I was most disgusted I had to make a nagging three day  
journey recently from Calcutta to Bombay.  It was very boring and  
tiring.

I remember that once, a friend did not co-operate with me due to  
some unavoidable reasons.  Unaware of this I treated her unjustly  
till I realized everything, and then I felt ashamad of my deeds.
my honest intentions were marred by another's jealousy.

an event took place in another's life and which I thought I  
could have avoided.

The day I was happiest was the day I received a phone call  
from Eve's Weekly to inform me that I had won the first prize of  
the All India Essay competition.  I had won this prize I was  
an under-graduate even post graduates had participated.  I  
had been judged by eminent judges and political scientists.

I have once been very sad and lonely.  This was I was trying  
to organize a play as a student (15 years).  Instead of  
materializing, it fizzled out.  The worst thing was that the play  
fell apart completely and I found myself weeping uncontrollably.   
Now I think of it, I laugh it off; but at that time it was  
intense.

This is an incident that many of us witness in our everyday life  
in a city like Bombay.  One day I was travelling by bus, three  
men dragged two fellows out of the bus.  Once outside they were  
beaten into pulp.  These two fellows, who got beaten, were pick-pockets  
and they were being beaten by all and sundry.  I thought to  
myself -"what is life?".  It is one hell of a place where  
everyone is after someone else.  One waits to cut the throat of  
the other one just for a living, (money).  I think about  
such things - the purpose of life, etc, I feel very disgusted and  
dejected.

A new gas connection was to be installed and the mechanic who came  
to do it was very rude to my mother and me.  I rushed to thhe  
dealer with my mother and had a fight with the dealer as he  
seemed to be unreasonable and was taking the mechanic's side.   
Ultimately the matter was resolved after my father went and spoke  
to him.  The mechanic was asked to apologize.

We had come back from a programme and we were all (three girls)     
staying over at another girls placce.  One of them started  
passing very nasty and outright bitchy remarks at me.  It was  
brought on by a male colleague's compliments to me, this girl was  
herself interested in this guy.  Bitchiness and catty remarks  
made by women never fail to disgust me.  I can particularly  
remember this incident as she knew that I had not encouraged the   
guy.

I was learning judo and my instructor wanted me to assist him in  
teaching girls judo at a suburban college.  I was just a beginer,  
and he made me a green belt so that I would be able to command  
respect.  This was against my principles, and yet I allowed myself  
to listen to him.  I gave it up soon after, however I felt very  
ashamed at not sticking to my principles and at not having put my  
foot down earlier.

I was coming back home with my mother the purse I was  
carrying got stolen.  It was done so swifty that I did not  
realize what had happened till much later.  A lot of money and the  
keys of the house were lost.  I was guilt ridden at my  
carelessness.  I felt terrible as I do not normally loose things  
and this was quite important, especially the keys.

I had gone to a school picnic and was left behind in the  
forest.

I saw a few people beating a man who seemed to be a  
stranger.
India lost the Benson and Hedges cricket trophy.

I was responsible for getting my friend run-out in a vital  
cricket match.

India won the Prudential cup by beating West-Indies in the  
final match and became the world cricket champion.  West-Indies  
was the strongest of the eight countries which participated in  
the competition.

As a child, one evening I had read a novel about ghosts and I had  
thus spent a sleepless night as I kept feeling that there were  
ghosts dancing around me.

Despite our good performance and excellent results the management  
refused to meet our demands.

I heard that a 14 years old girl had been raped by four  
rikshaw drivers in our town.

I feel ashamed at the fact that even after 35 years of independence    
70% of the Indian poulation is still below the poverty line.

I read about the national and social spirit and self-discipline  
of the people of developed coutries like U.S.A, England, France,  
Germany etc.  Comparing this to the Indian people I felt guilty  
as they have no national spirit or self-discipline.

I felt happy at the settlement of our marriage, even though we  
are from different socio-linguistic backgrounds our parents  
agreed to the wedding without any conflict or discussion.  We had   
thought that they would object to the wedding but it did not happen.

One day, early morning my mother who is healthy fell ill.  There  
was no doctor or compounder near by and for a few hours -8 A.M to  
6 P.M she did not speak a single sentence, nor did she drink water  
or  milk.  There was no movement in her body and I felt really  
scared.  I almost lost my confidence about her survival.

I had this feeling before my graduation and never dared to speak  
to my relatives and  friends.  Because of this feeling I would  
avoid situations, however I do not know the reason for this.

One day my mother forced me to eat more and I refused, the next  
day she served me more rice and mutton pieces than usual.  I  
saw this I got very angry and scolded her, and refused to eat.   
Later I felt guilty and asked her to excuse me.

I was in my village one of my enemies had written a  
non-sense letter to a girl and he told the father of this girl  
that I was the culprit.  I got to know this I was scared as   
the girl's father was a worse man.

I was doing research a few months ago, I had asked the  
Institute to sponsor me for a computer course which was held in  
TISS.  However, because of the administrative officer I could not  
get the money.

I was in Bombay one of my good friends was getting married  
and he had not informed me about it, this made me sad.

I once got a phone call stating "one of your friend is in jail,  
please come and see him".  I went to the jail and saw him, I  
was disgusted.

Some time back I had signed a letter which I had not read.  What  
had happened is that something had been written against my  
friend and this went to the higher authorities.  My friend asked me   
-"you also signed ?"

One of my friends came to know through some other friends that I    
had applied for some course in an institute.  He asked me "why  
did not you tell me, I would also have applied."  At that I felt  
guilty.
[ I am neutralfull to be alive every night.]
[ I have not felt this emotion yet.]

[ On discovering the red-tapism and the bureaucratic, corrupt,  
decadent, degenerated infrastucture of every public utility,  
office and service; and the rampant corruption at every single  
level of education and other institutions.]

The death of Jaya Prakash Narayan caused a great deal of sadness  
as I believed that he was the only true democrat and a ray of  
hope on the Indian horizon.

[ This is an everyday feeling.  Many situational events : causes  
are unclean and dirty environment, illiteracy, poverty and  
neglect of human resources, disgust at the lack of perception on  
the part of us ( educated few) for the lack of drive and drive  
towards their redemption. ]

I realized that I belonged to a country which is amongst the  
poorest in the world and that inspite of having the resources we  
do not utilize them.  I was ashamed at myself and my country,  
shame at the lack of parity between the lifestyles of the  
citizens.

I realized that I was not working hard enough and was not  
being useful as an individual to the society or the family, guilt  
at spending money on uncalled for activities - in short wasting  
my life.

My neutral knew no bounds I was selected for a job even before  
having finished my studies.

I was scared I realized that I might miss the train which I  
was supposed to take.  I was 1500 Kilometres away from home and   
I heard the depart whistle I was still 150 feet away from the  
train.  I finally made it.

I felt angry repeated pleas to the ticket collector and the  
co-passengers in order to make a queue fell on deaf ears.  I have  
this feeling whenever someone is not disciplined and methodic in  
doing his duty.

I am filled with gloom and sadness at the death of a person.   
More specifically, I felt sad after hearing the news of a  
death of a person who was hale and hearty and full of life, with 
vigour and plans for the next day but had no next day to cherish it.

I feel disgusted since I am unable to cope with all the wordly  
affairs as I spend much precious time to pursue my hobby and  
to be admist the people I love and long to be with.

I always feel ashamed I do not succeed in accomplishing  
something in which I had put in all my efforts.

At times I have been attracted to conducts which are socially  
degraded due to their ill consequences, and then I feel guilty.
India first won the world cup cricket tournament.

I was then in the 10th standard and was going to my native place.  
 The last bus had already left and so I started walking, it soon  
became quite dark.  The road was a village road and was deserted,  
I was not even sure if that was the right way.  I finally reached  
home at 10 P.M.

I was travelling from Delhi to Bombay.  I had booked a seat one  
month back and I had also got a telegram confirming this.   
However, in the train my name had been omitted from the  
reservation sheet, and the one seat that was still vacant was  
alloted to another person who paid for it despite my requests for the  
seat.  I was allowed to stay in the reserved compartment I  
paid money.

The news of the natural calamity, an earthquake in which hundreds   
of Mexican people died.

In Punjab, in the name of religion people killed each other  
during the agitation.

I felt happy at the end of a 10 day student camp.  We had shared  
our hopes and aspirations and in the open situation so generated, we  
had made strong frienships and experienced our own worth as well.

One of my fellow students had bunked field work and in my attempt  
to cover up for him I myself was exposed, though not directly.   
We were to meet our field work suprevisor and we were afraid of  
the consequences.

I had made an error in planning a programme and had publicly  
accepted the mistake, despite repeated requests not to bring the  
matter for discussion a professor kept constantly passing remarks.  
I reacted angrily.

I was in love with a girl but had to separate from her because of  
different commitments concerning life and career.  I loved her as  
a person but could not agree with the life the future would  
demand.  Parting from her was very sad.

Students on campus were unnecessarily creating trouble just to  
heckle the authorities - not to achieve something concrete, but  
to further their own interest.

I had reacted angrily at a friend for no fault of his.  I had  
raised my voice and had not cared for his opinion.

I had promised to send something to a friend and it completely  
slipped my mind.  I felt guilty for having forgotten.

This is one feeling I never betray, but I must confess that the  
last time I slighty felt happy was I passed my M.A with a  
high rank.  This was a few years ago my friend told me about  
the result.

A few weeks back I had a very important seminar and I had  
circulated my papers to all the panel members.  A day before the  
seminar I realized that I had inadvertantly burdened certain        
derivations and I had failed to correct it.  I feared that this     
would reflect very badly on my performance.  Fortunately none of   
the panel members detected it and I felt relieved.

A few days back a friend of mine poked me in the ribs for fun's  
sake, though I had warned him an infinite number of times that it  
really hurts me, he did it again.  I usually ignore this but this  
time I flared up for a split second and threatened to bash him  
up.  This is the latest incident I lost my temper, though I  
felt very bad about it later.

The saddest moment in my life was I lost my younger sister a  
few years back.

Yesterday, I was just about to cross the road a country guy  
who was ahead of me spat out a mouthful of betel juice on the  
road.  It was very windy and had I not checked my speed I would  
have had a very good shower of his saliva.  Though I was not  
angry, I felt that these people were very indecent.

Yesterday while playing volley ball, there was one person extra     
and somebody had to out.  A mess worker and I were the   
last ones to arrive and we had arrived at the same time.   
Rightfully one of us had to opt out of the game, as I was  
delaying leaving the mess worker opted out saying that I should  
play.  I felt ashamed of myself.

A few days back a friend of mine had asked me to call on him on  
Sunday.  I had accepted it but later did not go for no specific    
reason.  I just slept in my room.  The next day this friend called   
me up and told me that he had been expecting me the day before and  
his wife had prepared a very good lunch for me, which had gone  
waste.  I felt very bad about this incident and it has been  
growing in my heart ever since.
Before the declaration of the S.S.C results.
I was punished in school for no serious mistake of mine.

I could not attend the college picnic due to some  
difficulties.

I was detained one day in school, by the vice-principal, for  
indiscipline.

One day at school I had quarrelled with a school-mate, and  
ultimately I had hit him hard.  He, being physically weak had to  
visit his doctor and remain absent from school for two days.

This happened I was in the 10th standard.  The paddy crops  
were in a bad shape as it had not rained and there was no water  
in the well, so I was in a very sad mood.  I came to the  
conclusion that I would ignore the paddy field, just 12 hours  
after this it rained for one hour.  This was a very tense time  
and the rain brought me tremendous pleasure.

At the age of 16 I had gone to see a film in a nearby village,  
about 8 kms  from my home.  I started walking as there was no  
bus.  I had to cross hills and as it was dark I could not  
identify the path.  Half way through it started raining and as  
there was no shelter I ran four kms to reach home.

One day my room-mate started imitating me, doing what I had done  
a few hours back.  I got very angry and started beating him up.

A few months a close relative of mine died.  I had never expected  
this to happen and was sad for a few months.

One day, at an important place I met a group of girls and while  
we were waiting for a bus these girls started smoking and  
commanded me to smoke; I felt very disgusted.

A few months back I had gone to my friend's place and they offered  
me tea and coffee.  I do not have the habit of drinking tea or  
coffee and so they offered me a glass of milk instead, so I felt ashamed.

At my native place I was riding my cycle, which did not have  
lights, at night and so a police man caught me.  I requested him  
to let me go but he would not so after a few minutes I just  
escaped.

This was the worst incident of my hostel life.  I was insulted by  
a close friend of mine on the eve of the New year and it totally  
spoiled my New year's night.
[ I feel that I have made a mistake.]

Once a friend had pushed me and I had fallen on to a window which  
then broke.  I was taken to tthe principal's office and he  
accused me of having broken the window.

My illness a few years back.  I was sevely down with malaria and  
asthma, I had lost my health, charm and cheerfulness completely.
During the short period of my unemployment about six years back.

My father's death in January 1983 moved me deeply.  The gloom  
prevailed for almost two years and I am still to recover from it.

I was 12 years old I was caught by the Ticket Collector  
travelling without a ticket.

A few lies that I had indulged in, a few years ago, while raising  
loans from my friends.

After having finished my B.Sc, I was struggling hard to continue  
my studies and had taken the M.SC exam.  I was not sure that I  
would be selected in the written exam.  I saw my name in the  
selected candidates list I was overneutraled.

I was dancing with a dame at a social, one of my friends who   
was interested in her came and took her away from me.  I was  
really angry with him then.

a close friend, residing in the hostel, lost his father I  
really pittied him and the situation made me feel sad.

I was in the 12th standard, I could not speak English.  One  
day, while  talking with my relatives I used a wrong word and   
my cousin corrected me, believing that I did not know English.  I  
really felt ashamed then.

I was doing an experiment and was not getting the appropriate  
result despite the fact that I had repeated the procedure 4-5  
times.  Then finally I got it right by a stroke of luck.

Once I was very frightened at night as I had a very fearful and  
terrifying dream, I could not go back to sleep for a long time.

Once I had an argument with my friends and I knew that I was  
right.  My friends went on arguing with me even though they did  
not know the right thing.

My elder sister forced me to do a few things which I did not like  
to do.

Once I had torn a few pages off a library book and I felt ashamed  
at this.

After I was thrown out of a car in an accident, this resulted in  
a fracture.

I felt disgusted I was in a helpless position at the loss of  
my fiancee.

The day my fiancee told me that it was bad that I could not write  
my mother tongue.

I felt guilty I thought that I was still not standing on my  
own feet.

The way this particular girl spoke, behaved, and reacted the  
first time I was introduced to her, I felt certain that something  
between us would materialize.

a girl did not answer a question, concerning my love for  
her, put forward to her.

I was travelling in a bus from school going home for holiday. In  
the bus unfortunately I stepped on a bag in which there were  
delicate things.

On May 20th I got a summon to appear in court on May 28th 1985 on  
the subject of impregnanting a school girl. I really feared of  
standing in the court in a few days time after this notice. I was  
also embarassed due to formal approach that was expected of me to  
the Principal.

Sometime ago I felt very angry my mother wrote me telling me  
that my elder sister was messing up things at home by her  
internalised aggressive attitude towards parents and her husband.

Four weeks ago I felt very much touched to find an asciatic  
patient who had asked the very morning to be tapped of the fluid,  
dying in the evening. I was really disgusted because this was the  
Medical staff's negligence. Had the Clinical officers done  
something that very morning he might have been alive today.

I had a cousin whom I loved so much. Unfortunately she passed  
away suddenly and one time I had a dream in which I was talking  
to her yet she is dead.

I had experienced odd moments one time a patient came into  
the Ward in which I was working. The patient was badly burnt in  
the right side of her body. I was very nervous at the sight.

I was young I was playing football near my parent's house  
and while playing I fell on the ground. At first I thought I was  
not seen by anybody, but my mother laughed I felt very  
ashamed.

I had been on friendship with a certain girl for sometime and the  
love was going on well, but it happened that I made the  
friendship come to an end suddenly without good reasons.

I was emotionally happy I was in love with the girl I had  
longed for.

I once felt that my last hour had come I was unexpectedly found  
in the hands of.

I was all of the sudden sad I heard that my cousin who  
usually paid school fees had passed away after a very short  
illness.

The first day I visited the hospital I was disgusted because I  
experienced offensive smell which I never expected. I nearly ran  
away from the course.

I once felt shame I failed to fulfil the promise to marry a  
daughter of a certain gentleman.

I felt guilty I was robbed of a friend's radio at Lilongwe  
bus depot after promising that I would keep it safe.

I heard a rumour that the 1st year exam results were out. I  
had fear that I might be one of the failures.

Somebody was blaming me of a story which was not real and not  
true.

Death of my grnadfather after having been in hospital for so long  
with cancer of the Oesophagus.

I had not done well in Geography at my MCE I was expected to  
get more than I did.

a patient had died soon after I had told the guardian to  
wait outside the ward.

I passed my Primary school leaving certificate and selected  
to go to a Boarding secondary school.

I was feeding a premature baby (7 months), the baby chocked.  
This was I was working in children's ward I thought I had  
killed the baby.

We were just about to go into the Exam room and I didn't see all  
my writing materials plus the identification card from the place  
where I left them.

The time I cleaned the house and everything was tidy,  
then my cousin, who is 4 years old, came with a muddy pot and made  
a mess of the whole thing.
Bad temper of the serving lady in the students' dining hall.
Teacher suspected me stealing money.
Failed to do what I had promised.
Saw on TV China winning the gold medals.
Staying in the room alone at night.
An old lady slipped and nobody helped her.
A friend's mother died.
Saw a dirty street.
Not collecting homeworks in time to give the teacher.
Not helping other people to do their homework.
Made a wonderfull new friend.
My friend started to misunderstand and hurt me.
Insulted by disgusting people.
My friend was badly hurt.
Someone not responding to my criticism.
Swearing in public.
Hurt someone's feelings unintentionally.
Before an examn.

Finding out that old and useless practitioners of retirement age  
will go to your English lectures and they do not understand  
English.
China cannot give your lectures bigger place and sound system.
I am not good enough for your experiment I am doing.
Winning a game after a long time of losing.
Almost had a bicycle accident.
People not cueing in the dining hall.
Failed an examn.
Saw a real party leader.
Failed to recagnize a friend on the street.
Forgot to collect post for a friend.
Being chosen to do your experiment with aphasia.

You may find out that I am stupid and not to let me do your  
experiment.

Talking to friends about how old you are and we cannot be as  
successful as you at your age.
Telling friends about your nickname.
I got better marks in the examn than many arrogant people.
Before the examn.
Insulted by some stupid people.
Lost a friend.
Hear people talking at my back.
Saw something stupid and ignorant happening in the countryside.

I was most angry India lost the Triangular Cricket trophy  
held in Australia.  I was so angry that I fought (orally) with my  
friend.

I was disgusted at myself I dropped a vital catch, while  
playing a cricket match, and we lost the match; though the catch  
was difficult.

There is one thing which makes me feel shameful,  I see  
friends of my age group working and earning a lot, I am  
still studying.  A friend I met a week ago after a period of 5  
years is earning more than Rs 3000/ month.

I felt guilty I read an advertisement for a job as a chemist  
in the newspaper and my friend asked me if I had applied for  
that job, I told him that I had not even seen the paper of that  
day.

I got my first unknown compound while doing my M.Sc  
research, I was very happy.  This is because my research was based  
on this type of reactions and compounds.

I had insulted my father two years back, at that time I was  
very angry due to some reasons.

I missed an opportunity to go abroad because of some silly  
mistakes for which I had to suffer a lot.

It was at the time of my M.Sc exam, I was not in a position  
to take the exam after having studied seriously.

I opted for my research field, for them the percentage of  
marks was more important than my knowledge.

I was not in a position to control myself.  I had said too  
much and had been cruel with no other than my mother.

Two days after the above incident, I was thinking about my  
morally shameful act and I felt sorry for that incident, but it  
was too late, however I did realize this.
I got the first compound through column.
I did not get the compound which is known.
I got low marks in B.Sc final.
my first love was not successful.
[ mix was coming from column for several days.]
I had been angry at my friend without any reason.

I forced a close friend of mine to ask a girl things about  
herself.

It was about a fortnight ago, I was declared successful in the  
U.G.C exam this year (only four in Bombay succeeded).  My neutral  
knew no bounds.

I was a kid, I always opened the door to greet my father  
he came back from work.  One day it so happened that his  
hair was scattered due to over-crowding in the train, and I  
opened the door as usual I saw something else.  I was so scared  
that I could not talk.

I was disgusted our cricket team manager dropped me from the  
team.

I felt very guilty a student, sitting in front of me in the  
exam, asked me a few questions and I did not show him the answers,  
 though I knew them.
I passed the TOEFEL with very good marks.

I lost the notes of the lecturer I had borrowed from my  
friend.
I was bluffing in front of my mother to get more money.

The moment I got the news that I had been selected for the U.G.C  
junior national research fellowship.  It was a dream come true.

I wanted to go to Bhopal for relief work (gas tragedy).  My boss  
simply refused to let me go, I was so angry that the only thought  
that came to my mind was to quit the job.

There was a family fight in my house some time back.  My uncle  
had given me a watch as a present and I lost it.  During the  
fight he accused me of having sold the watch.  I was disgusted at  
his false accusations.

My friend had written a letter to me, the contents of which I  
misunderstood and I wrote back a very harsh letter to her.  On  
realizing the blunder I had made, I felt like hiding my face in  
the sand.

While I was pushing a court roller out of a ditch, I slipped and  
fell down and the roller rolled back towards me -down slope-It is  
a miracle that I still have my legs intact.

I was the compere at a party and all my efforts to get the show  
rolling were thwarted by the immobile, non co-operative guests.   
I felt frustation - bordering on anger.

A railways officer, asked by the ticket checker to produce  
his tickets, got very aggressive and started abusing and using  
his authority in a very wrong way.
[ I am quite shameless, not applicable.]
I was successful at my work I was full of neutral.
I was treated improperly by someone.

[ bad and disgusting language is uttered by people, or  
someone tries to show what is beyond his own capacities.]

[ I missed my twin I was on the verge of being thrown, which  
I disliked.]

Kanishka was blown up, I really felt disgusted at people  
killing each other.

I received the best actor award at the inter-college drama  
competition.  It gave me tremendous neutral and satisfaction which  
lasted for several days.

my mother met with a serious accident and there was danger  
that she would not survive and if she did she would loose  
her memory.

an acquaintance of mine beat up another person for no just  
reason, and thus showed off his power.

a friend of mine died in a hiking accident.  I was not  
present there and only got the news later.

I felt this emotion my name was announced on the radio that  
I had been selected to come to Lilongwe School for Health  
Sciences to take a training course as a Medical Assistat.

I felt angry my only pair of trousers was stolen and could  
not be able to find out who the thief was or anyone who knew  
about the story.

I felt sad my dear friend was needed from training school  
due to his failure in a number of subjects and simply didn't know  
what he had to do.

I felt the emotion I entered a certain ward in the hospital  
to visit my relative who was sick.

I felt the above condition I was found in a house playing  
with another man's wife where I was asked questions and I was  
unable to answer.

I felt the emotion I fought somebody who was drunk and tried  
to disturb us while we were having meals.

I was at school, no one thought I could pass my MCE so at  
the end of the year my name was announced on the radio that I had  
passed. I was the happiest person.

One of my best friends was found lying flat on the road because  
he was drunk and was taken by the police and put in a cell. I  
went to see him the following morning, the place was really a  
mess and was smelling badly. I didn't like it.

One day I took my playmates to the river to swim and play. One  
of them was epileptic so he drowned into the water. I felt guilty  
because it was me who took them there.
I was accepted to study at this school I was very happy.

I was moving in the graveyard at 6.00 pm one day and was griped  
by fear because I was told that ghosts detain people moving there  
at night.

There is a mad boy in our village. This boy hit me with a raw  
paw-paw in the face.

In Ward 1A was an epileptic patient who was burnt the whole body  
and was stinking very much such that the whole ward was affected.  
Few people could come near him.

An out-patient asked me to read for him a certain prescription  
but I was unable to do so. The patient was dissappointed and lost  
hope in me.

It is some years ago my mother found me stealing relish in  
the pot. It was fresh fish which was very appetising.

It was in December last year that I was chosen to come to this  
Institution to study as a Medical Assistant.

In March I was busy studying during the night I could only sleep  
two or three hours only for fear that I would be weeded and sent  
back.

I was once nominated as an Officer Cadet in the Armed Forces and  
my name was cancelled on the list of nominees of those who were  
sent to Kenya for Training.

I was once called in court in Zemba Traditional court to answer a  
charge of impregnanting a young lady, I felt guilty for she had  
some letters which I used to write her as an exhibit in court.

There was neutral in me I heard that I was to take a course as a  
Medical Assistant.

I saw a dead body in the mortuary I became afraid and I was  
filled with fear.

A certain Area Party Secretary came home in the morning and said  
we had to leave our home and build somewhere and the reason  
being that they wanted to establish a market. The Chairman knew  
nothing about it and was very angry.

I was so sad I heard that my Uncle had passed away. He was  
the only man who was supporting my parents as well as myself.

I took Pharmacology books from my friend's desk without  
permission and I was found guilty.

I was in Form 4, at Secondary School, I was elected as a  
school Library Assistant and also the leader of Catholic  
Students, so I felt very neutralous.

I broke my Uncle's Radio player accidentally and so I feared that  
he was going to cut me off from going to his house as well as  
playing it again.

It was in March 1985 one of my fellow students borrowed my  
wristwatch and after sometime he broke a glass of that watch I  
got angry he was telling me but the anger didn't take long  
to fade.

I was disgusted with the behaviour of one of my fellow students  
during my Secondary School life. He was a habitual noise-maker  
and caused great conflicts with the teachers.

Sometime back I came across a certain man who was badly beaten by  
some people because he was found raping the wife of the village  
headman.

The neutral came to me I heard that I was going to start a  
Medical course at the Lilongwe School for Health Sciences.

The emotion came I misbehaved at school and the Principal  
threatened me that I was going to be expelled.

The emotion came a certain boy opened my locker without my  
knowledge.

The emotion came to me a certain girl who was not polite to  
her mother hit her sister severely.

I was told that I was selected to attend Medical Assistant  
Training.
I was told to attend an operation in theatre.

This situation happened my friend John ate my banana which I  
kept in the cupboard.
I was told that my father had passed away.
This situation occurred I entered into a smelling ward.

This situation happened my friend me with a knife which I  
stole from him.

my father married a certain lady. The reception was held at  
Kasungu town Hall.

At night I was coming from Lingadzi Inn I heard a hyena  
crying in the Lingadzi jungle. I was alone.

I felt disgusted a certain lady spoke words of sarcasm  
I was trying to propose to her.

I felt guilty I was given a prize which belonged to someone  
else.

I was given a wristwatch by my first girl and after two days  
another girl of mine also gave me a wristwatch.

I had been caught red-handed having stolen some paw-paw. I was  
then taken the elders owning the paw-paws.

I was double crossing Mercy and Maria. They one day came to know  
each other. I was found by Mercy red-haded I was with Maria.

Our Headmaster came to our hostel. The lights were off but there  
was a lot of noise. We shouted at him he knocked at our  
door. We later saw that it was the Headmaster.

This happened I was selected to go to Secondary school to  
start Form I in October 1980.

As I was taking venous blood from another patient I introduced  
air into the place of puncturing and there was a swelling which  
is dangerous to the patient hence I became afraid.

I really became sad mother passed away while I was very  
young.
I felt guilty I lost K43 for my friend he was arrested.

I felt neutral I passed my Malawi School Certificate of  
Education.

I had crossed Lilongwe forest I heard that there was a rabid  
hyena just near the path in the forest.

I was angry I heard that my only girl was going about with  
another man. So I decided to drop her but later the story came to  
be untrue.
I was presumed to have stolen maize from the school garden.

A certain colleague of mine sent me to buy a bag of flour for him,  
he gave me K20. Unfortunately I lost it.
I married my wife and took her home for the first time.
my friend was involved in a car accident.
I was charmed by my relatives.
my mother died in August 1978.

I entered the wound intensive care at the Central Hospital  
in Blantyre which was stinking.
I had beaten my auntie.

I had fear I was left alone at the bus depot at night. I had  
problems of how to move to this place.

I felt disgust I saw a friend walking in stagnant water  
without putting on gum boots.

I experienced shame I failed to keep a promise to meet my  
friend at the bus depot. He later came and asked me why I had not  
turned up.
The neutral came I first proposed a girl at Secondary School.

As I was in a ward one man died and I was instructed to watch the  
last offices. But this was my first time to see a dead person -  
fear came.

I was very sad I heard about the death of my teacher who  
taught me in Standard 8.

I was disgusted to see a person vomitting and I was told to clean  
the place where the vomit was.

I was ashamed a certain friend of mine I used to move with  
failed to propose to a lady yet we always said to ourselves no  
lady can refuse our proposal.

I felt guilty one of my secondary teacher left me while I  
was in Form three, he was the only one who showed love to me.
My sister gave birth to twins, healthy ones.

I was looking after my father's sheen in the forest. One day  
while playing with friends from neighbouring villages the flock  
escaped me and went into a far place. It became dark and I was  
afraid of father. I went home and hid myself.

I planned to travel a distance of 20 kilometres on my bike. I  
planned this I was working in the hospital. I went to  
the house I found that a friend had taken my bike without my  
consent.

It was in the evening I heard that my girl went to Zambia  
and that she would never come back.

A sister broke a cup and mother asked I was reported to have  
been responsible.

I was very sad I was shouted at by Uncle and was told that I  
was not to be given school fees because I didn't go to work in  
the garden since I had gone to escort my sister to the bus depot.

I was disgusted I was told to dress a big rotten stinky  
wound which, coming closer, made me feel like vomitting.

I was ashamed one day we were found stealing and roasting  
maize cobs from Agricultural experimental projects.

I felt guilty the truth was known about my impregnating the  
girl we were staying with.

I was walking alone along the place where people fear that there  
are always thieves there and the people who kill their friends  
during the night two months ago.

My first day to work in hospital, I was dressing wounds I  
was disgusted I came across one wound with a very bad smell.

It was my Instructor awoke me late at night to get prepared  
for the training at Military college he was coming back from  
his personal social activities.

I slept in a tent at the Barracks which caught fire at night and  
my best possessions got burnt in there.

It was my father beat my mother while she was ill for three  
weeks and now she was recovering.

parents of a certain girl refused to let me marry their  
daughter because I was not fit to do so yet the girl accepted  
everything and later she followed what her parents insisted and  
she told me never to talk to her again.

The time I was at secondary school during the holiday I appeared  
to my father while heavily drunk and I talked nonsense like in  
some sort of carefree.

This came in at one time I met a girl who I didn't expect to  
fall in love with me. Fortunately I tried my luck and she accepted  
my proposal. At the same time she was giving me a lot of money  
which was just like a miracle to me.
I was travelling at night.

I experienced this one of my friends reported to the  
Headmaster that I had gone out for beer, whilst the information  
was not true at all. So I had to fight the friend before the  
Headmaster.
I was at school.

This was one of the Clinical officers scolded us in the  
hospital on how to make beds but we did not deserve to be  
scolded.

That was soon after the results of the interview which nearly  
9,000 people attended in all the three regions of Malawi. My neutral  
came after hearing on the radio that I was one of the people  
selected to undergo the Medical Assistant training at the  
L.S.H.S.

Fear came towards the end of May the P.T.S. results were out  
after hearing the failure of my fellow three friends.

I was once this week angry soemone trying to compress my  
mind due to his nonsense speech which himself could not tolerate  
at all.

This condition accumulated in my mind funeral news was  
brought to my awareness, that a close relative had passed away.

A condition in which I was disgusted followed I lost money  
on my way home from the college.

I was very ashamed I was neglected by a certain friend whom  
I was thinking loved me very much.

I once felt guilty a certain passenger in the same (ship,  
plane ?) which I boarded coming from home lost his 10t which  
in fact fell into my pocket unknowingly.

It was I was selected to go to a Secondary school to start  
form I.

It was I stepped on a python (snake) unknowingly while it  
was sleeping near a baobab tree.

It was my friend had stolen my money (K10) and had  
disappeared.

It was my father was taken into detention by the CIDS for  
two years for a reason I don't know up to now.

It was I drunk urine during my childhood thinking it was  
water. My friend had urinated in the tin.

It was my father caught me with a girl in dark corners and  
asked me what I was doing there.

It was I injured a friend accidentally with a stone. It made  
a cut on the cheeks which resulted in suturing.

Time had struck 8 o'clock I heard from the radio that I had  
been selected to Robert Blake Secondary School for Form I. I was  
very happy for the selection. My parents and I were very happy  
and full of neutral.
I felt very angry after one driver had run over my beloved niece.

I felt disgusted I went to one of the Central hospitals  
where my hope of getting good treatment was turned down by one of  
the doctors who said I was alright despite my feeling pain.

I was in my room, I just heard that my Uncle had been caught in  
somebody's house with somebody's wife. He had to appear in court.  
I went to see what would happen to him.

I heard that I had passed Primary School Leaving Certificate  
and was selected to go for Secondary education.

I heard that there is teasing and bulling at Secondary  
School.

I heard that I was not to be provided with another pair of  
medical uniform.
I heard that my father had passed away.
I vomitted a lump of blood.

a certain girl I believed to be my life partner refused an  
engagement.

I didn't notify someone that he was summoned by a headmaster  
and as a result he ended being on a heavy punishment.

One time I set up my journey at night going to a certain bar. On  
the way I met my friends and they told me that two people had  
died because of heavy fighting. I proceeded on but with fear.

I found my baby whipped by my Auntie. I was really sad and  
up to this moment my sadness is still on.

I was really disgusted I saw one of my friends soiling on  
his clothes. I thought he was mad.

One day I took a packet of sweets from a certain Grocery at  
Nathenje. Then later on I started to feel guilty and realised  
that I had done a wrong thing to him.

we were going to Nkhoma last Saturday the vehicle was moving  
very fast, so I feared we might crash since the road was too  
rough.

they put the blame on me I scored the third goal at the  
match.

I felt very sad I lost my three Kwacha at civo Stadium  
Sam Mangwana was playing some Rumba records. That was not what I  
expected, I wanted some Disco records.

In ward 2A there was a patient suffering from Syphilitic  
Paraplegia and had pressure sores. The wounds had offensive smell  
that only a few people .... the place.

It was we were beaten or lost the football match by 5-1 and  
then I scored the third goal to my own side.

I scored the third goal to my own side at a football match  
against William Murray Secondary School and we were badly  
defeated.

On December the 28th I was filled with neutral I was told by my  
bosses that I had been selected to attend a course at the  
Lilongwe School for Health Scienced in Lilongwe.

It was last week on Saturday night I was at Mchesi. I feared  
to cross the Lilongwe River Bridge to come back to School due to  
darkness - until somebody had to escort me.

It was at Malawi Army, Dormer Squadron, some of my workmates  
got promoted to Seargents (sgts); we were having similar  
Ranks.

In May somebody blamed me that I made him to be caught while  
peeping during the Nursing Test which made me feel disgusted.

It was on January 1st 1985 I accidentally broke a Fanta  
bottle in a certain bottle store in Zomba.

One day I was busy day dreaming along the road and suddenly I  
heard the sound of jamming car braked behind me. I woke up from  
my dreams and it was about to crash me.

I was doing my last year at Secondary School I was robbed of  
my clothes, wristwatch and my pair of shoes. After investigations  
it was found that all the things were stolen by one of the boys  
in our hostel.

It was on 9th January 1983 I received a message from home  
telling me that my father passed away on the previous day with a  
history of cancer of the oesophagus. This time I was doing my  
third year of my Secondary School.

I was stopped from entering a party while I was at School but I  
had an Invitation card with me. This was done because they said I  
was too young to join elderly people.

A child was admitted in hospital with Meningitis. I was asked to  
do lumber puncture to obtain Celebral Spinal fluid for diagnostic  
purposes. Since the condition was already bad, the child died as  
soon as I finished the procedure.
I had an anticipatory honey-moon with my fiancTe.

it was found that I had gone out of the school premises  
without permisssion and at the wrong time.
my father died.
somebody made me touch human faeces.
Soiled my short trousers with faeces.

a crawling child got burnt because of my negligence to keep  
the child away from the fire.

I heard my name being announced on the radio that I had been  
successful in an interview for admittance for a medical Assistant  
training course. I was really happy and I enneutraled myself by  
dancing to music from the Radio cassette.

One time I was injured I was playing football at School in  
Blantyre. I was brought to the hospital while my leg was totally  
swollen. The x-rays confirmed there was no fracture but  
collection of blood n the muscles. I feared they started to  
incise the swollen part with surgical blade.

One day I was really angry all my food was eaten by a dog.  
My anger was against my mother because she was careless. She  
didn't keep the food in a hidden and proper place.

One time at the hospital I passed near the intensive care room.  
The offensive smell that came out disgusted me in such a way that  
I didn't even dare to enter the room.

At one occasion I was ashamed of being refused after a proposal  
for a friendship with a certain girl. I was ashamed because she  
refused publically in the presence of my fellow friends.

We went fishing some 5 or 8 kilometers off the shore of Lake  
Malawi. Before we could settle down the lake became very rough to  
the point of threatening our lives.

I was sad my MCE grades were out. I had gone for a football  
match a mile away from home. The mail found me there. I was  
disappointed and didn't play the other half of the match.

I was dancing Malipenga (traditional dance). I exaggerated the  
steps I was supposed to make in the negative way. This happened in  
front of spectators. It was bad for our Boma (group) because I  
was on the front line where ability is displayed and it is this  
ability that counts choosing the winning side.

I argued with my father on matters concerning marriage.  
Traditionally speaking, I was not supposed to, so I felt guilty  
of violating my traditions which I must hold in esteem.
Someone told a lie that I had stolen his money.

My Uncle was beaten by his troublesome son. He fell unconscious  
and gained consciousness after some time. That time I was at  
school; this news reached me through someone.

I answered a certain question from Dr. Maqgda wrongly. She asked  
something about Femur and my answer was saying something  
concerning the brain. So I was very ashamed amongst my friends.

I wrote a bad letter to someone concerning our relationship which  
we created ourselves.

I met a certain lady at Mchesi and I proposed a word of love to  
her and at the same time she accepted my proposal.

My father gave me money for school fees and I didn't pay school  
fees instead I spent it on beer and did not tell him about this.

It happened that one of my best friends just took my shirt  
without my knowledge, I hadn't put it on for many days and I was  
short of clothes.

I had high-heeled shoes one time, but a certain girl who saw the  
shoes told me that they were out of fashion and I looked as an  
old man I was in those shoes.

I happened to have met one of my teachers in town during working  
hours. The badness was I didn't ask for permission to go out and  
I was guilty-conscious.

As we were going to Area 10 a dog chased me. I was afraid it  
might bite me.

After hearing the news about the death of my sister, I felt very  
sad.

After buying a ticket, I lost it before I reached my destination  
and the bus Inspector dropped me at a place I didn't know.

I was very much ashamed after a friend beat me at school and I  
was defeated.

I hit my cousin badly after she threw away my dresses in a  
pit-latrine that the little girl fainted.

one of my relatives went out at night leaving me and my  
friend alone, I cheated my parents that she didn't go out, after  
they had heard that she was out, I was afraid that she might have  
beaten me.

a boy whom I refused to be my lover told all his friends  
that I was his girl he has refused me because I was not faithful  
to him.

someone pointed out that I was proud, yet I didn't dress up  
properly. This was I and my friend went for a dnce one  
Saturday.

After I had cheated my parents that I had lost my textbooks so  
they had to send me money.

I felt neutral I heard my name being called on the radio as one  
of the students who had passed the interview of Nursing and was  
selected to start Nursing.

I felt fear one night my aunt and Uncle left me alone at  
their house to look after the baby they went to a party.

I felt angry at one time I was chatting with friends and  
suddenly another friend joined us and started opposing any  
comment I added to our chatting.

I felt sad a thief stole all the clothes from my friend's  
cupboard at school (boarding).

I was sad I heard that my cousin died because of being  
bewitched by her husband's second wife.

My friend promised to take me out for a movie but he didn't turn  
up.

I met a woman who was looking for our house. She stopped me but I  
ran away. I arrived at home I found the same woman and she  
told my parents what had happened so I felt ashamed.

I went to my boyfrien's house. There I found clothes of a certain  
girl. Without asking whose clothes they were I started tearing  
them only to realise that they were his sister's and so I felt  
guilty.
I was selected to come here.

Somebody told her friend that she would hit me wherever we would  
meet.
I heard that my friend had started drinking beer.

I went to a party and there were some cakes which weren't good  
and had a bad smell.

I slapped my sister's daughter and after several hours, she had a  
high temperature and she ended up being admitted in hospital.

the church choir came one Sunday after being away for some  
weeks.

I came home late one day. I was afraid I would be shouted at  
by my parents.

I was watching T.V with my parents and some pornographic scenes  
came on, I felt uncomfortable and tried to distract my parents  
attention by talking to them.

I saw a program on T.V where they had to saw a skull for an         
operation.

I decided not to out any longer with a girl whom I liked  
quite a lot.  This made me feel low for a some time.

I and my cousin went to a filmshow at night. We went without  
making it known to my mother. While we were there at interval, I  
came across my mother just close to where we sat.

During the Xmas holiday, I and my best friend at Secondary School  
had planned to meet at a Cultural afternoon at the Mt. Soche  
Hotel after missing each other for such a long time. I asked  
my mother for permission, she told me not to go for no good  
reason. I felt very angry with her.

I felt disgusted my cousin decided that she would stop  
going to school saying she wanted to get married. She was only 14  
years by then and she didn't understand what she was thinking.

One day I was angry with my friend who went into my drawer and  
took a piece of paper on which I wanted to write a letter and  
used it for her business without my knowledge.

I was ashamed with my biology lecturer he asked me a  
question and I could not answer it.

One day I was chatting with children at home. Then I took a lump  
of soap and gave to one of them pretending that it was a sweet. I  
thought the child would realise that it was not. Unfortunately he  
did not and he put it in his mouth.

I wrote a difficult Exam at one time while in my Secodary School.  
the results were announced on the radio, I came second out  
of 80 students hence I felt neutral.

Last week a friend of mine called on me and said I was moody and  
difficult to persuade. With this I got angry with her.
I experienced this emotion my grandfather passed away.

In my village there was this tax collector who used to cheat  
people and collected more than was wanted, the surplus was for  
his family and himself.
I was called for an Interview at Kamuzu College of Nursing.
I damaged my wristwatch which I liked very much.
my cousin passed away.

I had stayed for months without seeing mother because our  
holidays were short and my home is far. Some times, mother came to  
see me at school, I was very neutralful, and I didn't want her to go.

One day during our clinical practices, we had a very ill patient.  
Unfortunately the patient passed away. I had seen him dying and  
it was the first experience. During the night I became afraid  
fearing the dead body.

It was during the beginning of the term. I had K100 and kept it  
in my handbag. I left the handbag in the wardrobe but didn't  
lock it. Next time I found that K30 were stolen.

I felt disgusted my appointment to meet the E.N.T.  
specialist had been turned down. The specialist came from U.K.  
and went the same day and we do not have one.

I had been telling lies and people discovered instantly that I  
was telling lies. I felt very shameful and I felt like  
disappearing from people.

I had an interview for entry into college. The results were to be  
announced on radio. After a long period of waiting the results  
were released. I had succeded - tension was relieved by neutral.

I stepped on a snake at home, it was dark but there was  
moonlight.

I went to a fair where a guy who was drunk kept bothering me and

I heard that my Uncle had passed away in a road traffic  
accident.

I was keeping a friend's Library book which went overdue. My  
friend was charged for the delay in returning the book to the

I was given a gift by my sister. There were many pleasant things

I was alone walking in a deserted part of the city and I had some

I wrote an Exam and happened to have not done as well as I  
thought I would. I was angry to myself for not having done so

I lost my purse that had money in it. I was sad until I found it.

I received a letter which was too strong for me. It said I had  
done something which I really didn't do.
A friend of mine was shouting at me in a group of juniors.

Before going to school I usually take something to eat right at  
school and this time I took Father's money without him knowing  
it. I felt guilty and I returned the money.

I was travelling home by bus and suddenly the bus hit and  
the bus leaned against a wall.

I was angry someone stole a magazine which I had borrowed  
from another friend and locked it in a drawer.

my best friend promised to come at my house and I had to  
prepare so many expensive things for her but only to learn at  
last that she would not turn up.

I felt disgusted one day when, as we were eating, a child  
defecated on the table side.

I felt guilty one day I stole a slice of bread in a  
cafeteria.

I was angry my friends said that I should not receive  
Nursing Science books because there was a rumour that I was  
intending to leave the college.
my cousin passed away.

I was a child I broke plates because I wasn't given food on  
the grounds of coming home late.
I felt guilty after stealing a cookery book from my colleagues.

I was filled with neutral I heard that I had been selected to  
come here at Kamuzu College of Nursing.

I was afraid to walk through the forest one day I dropped  
off the bus around 6.30 pm.
I was angry somebody stole my half petticoat.
I felt sad my father was sick.

I felt guilt to have come back from home without seeing my father.  
I went home he was at work.
Afraid of a dead body.
A tailor ran away with my skirt.
Cooks refused to give me food.
I saw a septic, smelling wound.

I was ashamed I was being introduced to the church  
congregation.
A boy I had been admiring so much asked me to go out with him.

I was playing with friends then I decided to splash some sand  
into a car which was moving nearby. The driver got angry and came  
to report to my parents.

My father who is very quiet discovered I was going out with a  
coloured boy. He called me names and was really upset.

I was at a boarding school during my primary school days. I was  
broken so I pretended I was very sick. My father came and he  
picked me up. He spent a lot of money on medical expenses which  
all proved to be negative.

I felt so afraid dad fell ill, he had never suffered from  
that disease since and I had never seen him as he was.

It was extremely sad to me I heard that a patient who I was  
taking care of in hospital had passed away. He had some abdominal  
pains.

I felt this situation a certain woman from a close village  
shouted at my mother because she didn't get what she wanted, she  
wanted some salt to put in her relish.

At one time while at primary school I lost a pencil case of a  
friend and I didn't mention it to her until after a fortnight.
The time I first saw my cousin who is living in Tanzania.

I failed my Nutrition paper which was the paper ending the  
course.

a patient in the ward died (one who had been under my care).  
I felt as if I didn't give the appropriate care to the patient.

I was filled with neutral I heard that I had passed my Secondary  
school leaving certificate exam.

I was afraid my mother left me alone to live in our house  
for one month.

I was very sad I heard that my uncle had passed away  
untimely at home.

I dream of anything terrifying I used to have fear for the  
rest of the day that the dream might come true e.g., being beaten  
(or eaten ?) by a snake.

Once I offended a friend, instead of her coming to me to ask and  
discuss the matter she was just telling other people about it and  
say all she could about me.

I was once chatting with friends. Then some boys came and joined  
us. These boys took all my 3 friends away and I was left alone in  
shame without knowing where to go from there.

One day I found an incontinent man in the ward. This patient had a  
guardian who couldn't give him a bath. So I just left him like that  
but felt guilty until I went back to give him a bath.

I broke a window of a neighbouring house and I feared my mother's  
judgement and action on what I had done.

The carterer refused to give me sugar to add to my tea saying  
that there was no sugar whilst it was there, so I left the cafe  
disgusted without taking the tea.

I insulted my friend for a small reason and after time I realised  
that I was wrong and felt ashamed; everytime I meet her I feel  
ashamed.

My patient died of Anaemia while I was organising blood

I was selected to start Form I at Malosa Secondary school.
a thief entered the house in which I was sleeping.
my dress was stolen.

I boarded Yanu Yanu bus I sat near a man who was smoking  
tobacco.
I refused to fetch water for my aunty while she was busy.
I hit my young sister without a valid reason.

I was in the house at night and I heard a hyena crying outside.  
It cried for almost an hour and I feared it might break the  
window and enter inside the house.

I was angry at the Cafeteria the cook scolded and said many  
bad things about me without reason. He thought I was among the  
girls who did him wrong.
I was very sad I heard that my Auntie had passed away.

I was disgusted the other day I was told to take off the dog's

in the end I felt disgusted.

I was very ashamed I failed a test in Standard 7. The  
teacher told the other students to shout and laugh at me.

I heard that I had passed my MCE Exam, I spent the whole  
day dancing and eating sugarcanes from our garden.

I heard that my father had passed away. I could not eat for  
a week and was only crying. I could not find the courage to go to  
bath.

I wet my head (or bed ?) one day my sister discovered it and reported  
it to the other siblings. So my mother had to scold me.

I insulted my young sister for a very little misconduct of  
putting on my shoes. She wrote me an apology letter and the  
message she included made me feel guilty.

It was in 1983 September MCE results were being announced on  
the radio. I heard my name that I had done well I just kept  
quiet. I was so happy that I couldn't even talk.

I was on my way home suddenly Gule Wamkulu came from the  
bush and blocked the road. I was in fear and didn't know what to  
do.

A certain man went to my parents and told them that I was married  
here, I am here at school. I went home for holidays my  
parents asked me about it and I was angry with that man.

I went home on holidays I found that my niece and nephew had  
passed away I was very sad for the children were not even sick  
before death but suddenly died.

I met a certain lady at the bus depot who was using a bad  
language but was a very smart looking lady.

I wore a dirty dress a certain day I was going to town I met an  
old friend who made a comment about my dress so I felt ashamed.

I was neutralful I received a present (2 books and a pencil)  
from the headmaster in standard 6 because I had passed, I became  
No 1 and he said I was one of the pupils who had good behaviour.

I went to the prayer meeting at night and unfortunately the car  
broke down, so my other sister said I had to walk alone from  
Ndirande to Chirimba at around midnight. So we reached home at  
1 am. I was afraid of robbers and dardness.

I was angry the other day because the teacher told me to sweep  
some orange peels. It was my friends who were supposed to sweep,  
but the teacher told me to do it.

I was very disgusted the first day I went to put a dead body in  
the Mortuary. There were many dead bodies and some were uncovered  
so we had to put on top of the other bodies.

I was really shameful my mother beat me in the presence of  
my friends because I didn't cook lunch up until 2 o'clock.

I felt guilty the other day because I took two pieces of bread  
instead of one in the Cafeteria and some of the girls were short  
of bread.

I was happy to hear that my sister had won a prize at running  
competition.

I was angry I had not been granted a leave out pass during  
the last weekend.

I was disgusted my little sister had been hit badly by her  
friends.
I was ashamed to tell my mother that I fell down with a bicycle.

I felt guilty I had refused to lend money to my friend who  
needed it immediately.

I was asked to join my friend in a boat at Mangochi Lake Malawi

the side.

Somebody took my wristwatch and promised to have it mended and

rude at a certain time.

a certain drunk man slapped my buttocks I was quietly

I borrowed my friend's radio cassette and the plug cracked and

The patient whom I expected to get well suddenly passed away

I was to prepare relish for the family. I overcooked it and no
